pinnipotens: <entryFree id="n36369" type="main" key="pinni^po^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pinnĭpŏtens</orth>, v. pennipotens.</entryFree>
pinnirapus: <entryFree id="n36370" type="main" key="pinni^ra^pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pinnĭrăpus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. pinna-rapio</etym>, <sense id="n36370.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a peak-snatcher</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a gladiator</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:158" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 158</bibl>; cf.: pinnirapos autem dicit, lanistas ex habitu gladiatorum, quia post mortem retiarii pinnam, id est manicam rapit, ut ostendat populo se vicisse, Vet. Schol. ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
pinnula: <entryFree id="n36371" type="main" key="pinnu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pinnŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>1. pinna</etym>, <sense id="n36371.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little plume</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wing.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36371.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 143</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36371.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a little fin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 57, 83, § 175</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 11, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deut. 14, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pinophylax: <entryFree id="n36372" type="greek" key="pi_no^phy^lax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīnŏphylax</orth>, <itype>ăcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pinnofu/lac</foreign>, <sense id="n36372.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of crab</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> pinoteres, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 42, 66, § 142</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pinoteres: <entryFree id="n36373" type="greek" key="pi_no^te_res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīnŏtēres</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pīnŏthēres</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">pinno-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pinnoth/rhs</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">pinnoqh/rhs</foreign>, <sense id="n36373.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the pinna-guard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a species of crab found in the shell of the</hi> pina, <hi rend="ital">and fabled to keep watch over it</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:19:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 19, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 31, 51, § 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:150" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 11, 53, § 150</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pinsatio: <entryFree id="n36374" type="main" key="pinsa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pinsātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pinso, āre</etym>, <sense id="n36374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stamping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pounding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crushing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pinsitus: <entryFree id="n36375" type="main" key="pinsi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pinsĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from pinso.</entryFree>
pinso: <entryFree id="n36376" type="main" key="pinso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pinso</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pīso</orth>), <itype>pinsi and pinsŭi, pinsum, pinsĭtum, and pistum</itype> (pisatum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=158" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 158</bibl> Müll.), 3 (also in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:63" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 63 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>, the reading is pinsatur; archaic form of the <sense id="n36376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imperf.</hi> pinsibant, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=23" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 23</bibl> Müll.; v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> p. 147 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> Vahl.), <pos>v. a.</pos> <pb n="1379" /> <cb n="PIPE" /> [<foreign lang="greek">pi/ssw, pti/ssw</foreign>], <hi rend="ital">to beat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bray</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crush</hi>: pinsunt terram genibus, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 370</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 354 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">flagro,</quote> <trans><tr>to scourge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si communiter pisunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilum, quod eo far pisunt: a quo ubi id fit dicitur pistrinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=138" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 138</bibl></cit> Müll.: farinam, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 152, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvam passam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panicum pinsitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:6:5" default="NO">6, 6, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisente pilo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 10, 23, § 97</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:93" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 10, 20, § 93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui far pisebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 11, 28, § 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o Jane, a tergo quem nulla ciconia pinsit (v. ciconia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:58" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pinsor: <entryFree id="n36377" type="main" key="pinsor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pinsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pinso</etym>, for pistor, <sense id="n36377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a baker</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 152, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pinsus: <entryFree id="n36378" type="main" key="pinsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pinsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from pinso.</entryFree>
pinus: <entryFree id="n36379" type="main" key="pi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīnus</orth>, <itype>ūs and i</itype> (<case>dat.</case> pinu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:19:19" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 19, 19</bibl>; <sense id="n36379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi> only pinu; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">abl. plur.</hi> pinorum and pinis), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pi/tus</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n36379.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a pine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pine-tree; a fir</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fir-tree</hi>: Pinus silvestris, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 20, 33, § 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:95" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 25, 40, § 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex altā pinu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 389</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinos loquentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">evertunt actas ad sidera pinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Idaeae sacro de vertice pinus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gummi in cerasis, resina pinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 3, 11, § 42</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">The pine was sacred to Cybele,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 17, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">to Diana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 22, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:15:17" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 15, 17</bibl> (3, 12, 19); <cit><quote lang="la">Pan was represented with a pinewreath,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:638" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 638</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:331" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 331</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">too, Faunus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 137</bibl></cit>. The victors at the Isthmian games were also crowned with a pine-wreath, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 10, 9, § 36</bibl>.—Acc. to the fable, Pitys, i. e. pinus, was beloved by Pan; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, pinus amica Arcadio deo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:18:29" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 18, 29</bibl></cit> (20).—</sense><sense id="n36379.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The stone-pine</hi>, which bears an edible fruit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 16, § 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36379.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">any thing made of pine-wood</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pine-trees.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36379.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A ship</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos Mincius infestā ducebat in aequora pinu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 206</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:57" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis Pontica pinus Silvae filia nobilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 14, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbata praeside pinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 88</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36379.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A pine torch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque manum pinu flagranti fervidus implet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 72</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n36379.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A lance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spear</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:539" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 539</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36379.7" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An oar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:531" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 531</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36379.8" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A wreath of pineleaves</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:638" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 638</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:412" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 412</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:331" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 331</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36379.9" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A pine forest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallinaria pinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:307" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 307</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pio: <entryFree id="n36380" type="main" key="pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>pius</etym>. <sense id="n36380.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To seek to appease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to appease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propitiate</hi> by sacrifice (syn. place).—</sense><sense id="n36380.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Silvanum lacte piabant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:379" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 379</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">busta (i.e. Manes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 515</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Janus Agonali luce piandus erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:318" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 318</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36380.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36380.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To honor with religious rites</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to celebrate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi piem Pietatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aras ture,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 10</bibl></cit> (4, 9), 19: <cit><quote lang="la">in magicis astra piare focis,</quote> <trans><tr>to perform sacred rites</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:1:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36380.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To purify with sacred rites</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">procuro, lustro): si quid tibi piandum fuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:chapter=51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36380.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">seek to make good</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to atone for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expiate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">damna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors morte pianda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:483" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 483</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmen,</quote> <trans><tr>to avert by sacrifice the misfortune portended by lightning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:291" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 291</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nefas triste,</quote> <trans><tr>to atone for</tr>, <tr>avert the penalty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 184</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19, 194</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cometes terrificum sidus, ac non leviter piatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 25, 23, § 92</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36380.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To punish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avenge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpam morte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grande nefas et morte piandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:54" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36380.7" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To free from madness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=213" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 213</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">jube te piari de meā pecuniā: nam ego quidem insanum te esse certo scio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 2, 17</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pipatio: <entryFree id="n36381" type="gloss" key="pi_pa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīpātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pipo</etym>, <sense id="n36381.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a piping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chirping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whimpering</hi>: pipatio clamor plorantis linguā Oscorum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=212" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 212</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
pipatus: <entryFree id="n36382" type="main" key="pi_pa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīpātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36382.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a peeping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">piping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chirping</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pullorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=103" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 103</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
piper: <entryFree id="n36383" type="main" key="pi^per"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭper</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pĭpĕris</orth>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pe/peri</foreign> (Sanscr. pippali or pippalī, the same), <sense id="n36383.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pepper.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36383.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:26 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 7, 14, § 26 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et piper et quicquid chartis amicitur ineptis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 270</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 417</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:293" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 293</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rugosum piper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:55" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrum piper, a term intimating that the miser is as sparing of it as if it were something sacred,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36383.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of sharp, biting speech: <cit><quote lang="la">piper, non homo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 31</bibl>, n. 2.</sense></entryFree>
piperatarius: <entryFree id="n36384" type="main" key="pi^pe^ra_ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭpĕrātārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>piper</etym>, <sense id="n36384.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing pepper</hi> (late Lat.): horrea piperataria,<cb n="PIRA" />  Hier. in Chron. Euseb. ad a. XCII. p. Chr. n.</sense></entryFree>
piperatorium: <entryFree id="n36385" type="main" key="pi^pe^ra_to_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭpĕrātōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>piper</etym>, <sense id="n36385.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a silver dish to hold pepper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pepper-box</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasis argenteis legatis, continentur ... piperatoria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 6, 86</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
piperatus: <entryFree id="n36386" type="main" key="pi^pe^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭpĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36386.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">peppered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seasoned with pepper.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36386.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">garum piperatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:47:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 47, 5</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n36386.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭpĕrātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">peppersauce</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:3:14" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 3, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36386.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">peppery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pungent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">piperata facundia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36386.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Sharp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thievish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non fuit Autolyci tam piperata manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:59:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 59, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
piperitis: <entryFree id="n36387" type="main" key="pi^pe^ri_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭpĕrītis</orth>, <itype>is and ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">peperi=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n36387.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pepperwort</hi>, prob. <hi rend="ital">Indian pepper</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">piperitis, quam et siliquastrum appellavimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 17, 66, § 174</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:187" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 12, 62, § 187</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pipilo: <entryFree id="n36388" type="main" key="pi_pi^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīpĭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>pipio</etym>, <sense id="n36388.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to peep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chirp</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad solam dominam usque pipilabat (passer),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 3, 10</bibl></cit>; Poët. ap. Anth. Lat. t. 2, p. 294 Burm.</sense></entryFree>
pipinna: <entryFree id="n36389" type="main" key="pipinna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pipinna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, = parva mentula, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:72:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 72, 1</bibl>.</entryFree>
pipio: <entryFree id="n36390" type="main" key="pi_pi^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīpĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n36390.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chirp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whimper</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infantes pipiantes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Monog. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbres pipiavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Valent. 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36391" type="main" key="pi_pi^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīpĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n36391.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to peep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chirp</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aviarius auscultetur, si (pulli) pipiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 14</bibl></cit>; Auct. Carm. Philom. 30.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36392" type="main" key="pi_pi^o3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīpĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36392.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a young piping</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chirping bird</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a squab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servos habuit vectigales qui eos (palumbes) ex ovis et pullicenis ac pipionibus alerent,</quote> <trans><tr>from the produce of the eggs and chickens</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sever. 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pipizo: <entryFree id="n36393" type="main" key="pi_pizo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīpizo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pipio</etym>, <sense id="n36393.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the young of the crane</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 22</bibl>, n. 28.</sense></entryFree>
pipo: <entryFree id="n36394" type="main" key="pi_po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīpo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n36394.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to peep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chirp</hi>: mugit bos, balat ovis, equi hinniunt, gallina pipat, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 156, 25</bibl>; of the hawk, Auct. Carm. Philom. 24.</sense></entryFree>
pipulum: <entryFree id="n36395" type="main" key="pi_pu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīpŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pīpŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pipo</etym>, <sense id="n36395.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a peeping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">piping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chirping;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n36395.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A whimpering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">filioli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad Anton. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad Anton. 1, 3</bibl></cit> Mai.—</sense><sense id="n36395.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An outcry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upbraiding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te pipulo hic differam ante aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 2, 32</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pipulo te differam id est convicio, declinatum a pipatu pullorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=103" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 103</bibl></cit> Müll.: pipulo poscere, Cn. Matius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:9:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 9, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
piracium: <entryFree id="n36396" type="main" key="pi^ra_ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭrācĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pirum</etym>, <sense id="n36396.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perry</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jovin. 2</bibl>, n. 5; Ven. Vit. S. Radeg. 15.</sense></entryFree>
piraceus: <entryFree id="n36397" type="main" key="Pi_raceus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīraceus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trisyll.</orth>) and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīraeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*peiraieu/s</foreign>; also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīraea</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <sense id="n36397.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the celebrated port of Athens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">about five Roman miles from the city</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with which it was connected by long walls; the Pirœus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Porto Dracone</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Porto Leone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">In Piraeea cum exissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venio ad Piraeea: in quo magis reprehendendus sum, quod homo Romanus Piraeea scripserim, non Piraeeum (sic enim omnes nostri locuti sunt), quam in quod addiderim: non enim hoc ut oppido praeposui, sed ut loco ... Secutus sum Terentium (Eun. 3, 4, 1): heri aliquot adulescentuli coimus in Piraeeum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curre in Piraeum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex Piraeeo abire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Piraeeus ille magnificus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:32:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 32, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:13:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 13, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">e litoribus Piraei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Piraeeus et Phalera portuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 11, § 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:23:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 23, 3</bibl>.— In <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sunion expositum Piraeaque tuta recessu Linquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:563" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 563</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīraeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Pirœus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pirœan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Piraea litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:446" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 446</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:754" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 754</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 21, 23.</sense></entryFree>
pirata: <entryFree id="n36398" type="greek" key="pi_ra_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīrāta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">peirath/s</foreign> (an adventurer, hence), <sense id="n36398.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sea-robber</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corsair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pirate</hi> (syn. praedo): <cit><quote lang="la">nam pirata non est ex perduellium numero definitus, sed communis hostis omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:50:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 50, 146</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29:107" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 29, 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:31:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 31, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 228</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:6:11" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 6, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Capito et Numitor, Piratae Cilicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:94 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 94 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
piraticus: <entryFree id="n36399" type="greek" key="pi_ra_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīrātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">peiratiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to pirates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">piratic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">piratical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">myoparone piratico capto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:28:section=73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 28, § 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 26, 30, § 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laurea,</quote> <trans><tr>victories over the pirates</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Red. in Sen. 5, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36399.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pīrātĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">piracy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">piraticam queque ut musicam fabricam dici adhuc dubitabant mei praeceptores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cb n="PISA" /> piraticam facere, <hi rend="ital">to practise piracy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:chapter=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Red. in Sen. 5</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">piraticam exercere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:3:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 3, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:1:14" default="NO">22, 1, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pirene: <entryFree id="n36400" type="main" key="Pi_re_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīrēnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*peirh/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n36400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fountain in the citadel of Corinth</hi> (Acrocorinthus), <hi rend="ital">which sprung up from a blow of the hoof of Pegasus; hence sacred to the Muses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:25" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Heliconidasque pallidamque Pirenen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:prol. 4" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> prol. 4</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36400.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīrēnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*peirhni/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pirene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pirenian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ephyre,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Corinth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 391</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:240" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pirenida cessit ad undam (al. urbem),</quote> <trans><tr>to Corinth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:3:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 3, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tantalus securus undas hauriat Pirenidas, as king of Corinth,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 745" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 745</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pirithous: <entryFree id="n36401" type="main" key="Pi_ri^tho^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīrĭthŏus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*peiri/qoos</foreign>, <sense id="n36401.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Ixion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of the Lapithœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">husband of Hippodamia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and friend of Theseus. After the death of Hippodamia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">he descended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in company with Theseus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to the infernal regions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to carry away Proserpine; but was</hi>, <hi rend="ital">together with Theseus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seized and detained in chains. Theseus was afterwards delivered by Hercules</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who vainly endeavored to save Pirithoüs also</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:302 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 302 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amatorem trecentae Pirithoum cohibent catenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 7, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aegidae Pirithoique fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:6:26" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 6, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pirum: <entryFree id="n36402" type="main" key="pi^rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n36402.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pear</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:59:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 59, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 15, 16, § 53</bibl>; Cloat. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 2, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:73" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">insitiva decerpens pira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:19" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 88</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pirus: <entryFree id="n36403" type="main" key="pi^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n36403.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pear-tree</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insere nunc, Meliboee, piros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 24, 38, § 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:109" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 26, 46, § 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:103" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 25, 42, § 103</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">felix arbor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 20, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pirustae: <entryFree id="n36404" type="main" key="Pi_rustae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīrustae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36404.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in Illyria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pisa: <entryFree id="n36405" type="main" key="pi_sa1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. pisum.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36406" type="main" key="Pi_sa2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīsa</orth>, <itype>ae, and</itype>, less freq., <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīsae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pi=sa</foreign>, <sense id="n36406.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Elis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Alphēus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near which the Olympic games were celebrated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut Alphea rotis praelabi flumina Pisae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pisa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:327" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 327</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:238" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 238</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pisae Oenomai,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīsaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pisa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pisœan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arethusa, so called because, acc. to the myth, it rose in Elis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:409" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 409</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hasta,</quote> <trans><tr>of Oenomăus</tr>, <tr>king of Elis</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pisaeā lege trementem currere et Oenomai fremitus audire sequentis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the law by which any one who demanded Hippodamia in marriage</tr>, <tr>was compelled to contend in the chariot-race with her father Oenomaus</tr>, <tr>and</tr>, <tr>if defeated</tr>, <tr>was put to death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:41" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pisaeique tori legem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Cyn. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pisaeae ramus olivae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:99" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 99</bibl></cit>: praemia, <hi rend="ital">prizes</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 698</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <trans><tr>in which the Olympic games took place</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:8" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:421" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 1, 421</bibl>: ebur Pisaeo pollice rasum, <hi rend="ital">by the hand which wrought the Olympic Jove</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">that of Phidias</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:6:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 4, 6, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36406.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīsaea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Hippodamia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:386" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 386</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pisae: <entryFree id="n36407" type="main" key="Pi_sae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīsae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n36407.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very ancient eity of Etruria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a colony of Pisa in Elis</hi>, still called <hi rend="ital">Pisa</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alpheae ab origine Pisae, urbs Etrusca solo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 179</bibl></cit> Serv.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:1:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 20, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:401" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 401</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 39</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36407.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīsānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pisan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 2</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīsāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Pisans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 43</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36407.2" n="B" level="2"> ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīsas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pisatic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pisan</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4048</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36407.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīsātĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">born at Pisa</hi> (for Pisanus), found in Naev., acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=210" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 210</bibl> Müll. (prob. Latinized from the Greek form <foreign lang="greek">*pisa/ths</foreign>).</sense></entryFree>
pisander: <entryFree id="n36408" type="main" key="Pi_sander"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīsander</orth>, <itype>dri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pei/sandros</foreign>, <sense id="n36408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Polyctor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and one of Penelope's suitors</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pisanus: <entryFree id="n36409" type="main" key="Pi_sa_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīsānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Pisae, A.</entryFree>
pisas: <entryFree id="n36410" type="gloss" key="Pi_sas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīsas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, v. Pisae, B.</entryFree>
pisatilis: <entryFree id="n36411" type="main" key="Pi_sa_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīsātĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. Pisae, C.</entryFree>
pisatio: <entryFree id="n36412" type="hapax" key="pi_sa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīsātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>piso</etym>, <sense id="n36412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stamping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crushing</hi> (al. spissatio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 86:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 86, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pisaurum: <entryFree id="n36413" type="main" key="Pisaurum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pisaurum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <sense id="n36413.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">n.. a city of Umbria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the mouth of the Pisaurus</hi>, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Pesaro</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:15:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:11 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 11 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:7:2 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 7, 2 sq.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36413.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pisaurensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pisaurian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">T. Accius Pisaurensis,</quote> <trans><tr>of Pisaurum</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:78:271" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 78, 271</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 39, 40, § 128</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pisaurenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <pb n="1380" /> <cb n="PISC" /> <hi rend="ital">the Pisaurians</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 276, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">481, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1085, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36413.2" n="B" level="2"> ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pisaurĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">name of a slave liberated by the city of Pisaurum</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 438</bibl>, n. 17.</sense></entryFree>
piscarius: <entryFree id="n36414" type="main" key="pisca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">piscārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>piscis</etym>, <sense id="n36414.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to fishing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fish-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">copia piscaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forum piscarium,</quote> <trans><tr>the fish-market</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hamulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36414.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n36414.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">piscārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a fish-monger</hi>: nullus in piscariā piscis erat: inter piscarios nemo vendebat, Varr. in Perott. in Cornucop.—</sense><sense id="n36414.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">piscārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">fish-market</hi>, Varr. Fragm. <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
piscatio: <entryFree id="n36415" type="main" key="pisca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">piscātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>piscor</etym>, <sense id="n36415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fishery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscatio thynnaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:4:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 4, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:9" default="NO">7, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 6, 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
piscator: <entryFree id="n36416" type="main" key="pisca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">piscātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36416.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fisherman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fisher</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 48</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanii, coqui, fartores, piscatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscatores ad se convocat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:14:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 14, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:26" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 55:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 55, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscatoris instrumentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 6, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">PISCATORES PROPOLAE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 731</bibl></cit>, n. 450: <cit><quote lang="la">PATRONVS CORPORIS PISCATORVM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4115</bibl></cit>.—Fig.: <cit><quote lang="la">piscatores hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 4, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
piscatorius: <entryFree id="n36417" type="main" key="pisca_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">piscātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>piscator</etym>, <sense id="n36417.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to fishermen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fishing-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <trans><tr>fishing-smacks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">casa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harundo,</quote> <trans><tr>a fishing-rod</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 66, § 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lina,</quote> <trans><tr>of which nets were made</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 9, 40, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscatorii ludi vocantur, qui quotannis mense Junio trans Tiberim fieri solent a praetore urbano pro piscatoribus Tiberinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=238" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 238</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:239" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 239</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscatorium aes vetusto more appellatur, quod in monte Albano datur pro piscibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=210" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 210</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
piscatrix: <entryFree id="n36418" type="main" key="pisca_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">piscātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36418.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that fishes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rana, quae in mari piscatrix vocatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 42, 67, § 143</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Gud.</author> 192, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
piscatura: <entryFree id="n36419" type="main" key="pisca_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">piscātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>piscor</etym>, <sense id="n36419.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fishing</hi> (post-class. for piscatus), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
piscatus: <entryFree id="n36420" type="main" key="pisca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">piscātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (<sense id="n36420.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> piscati, Pompon. et Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 488, 16 sq.</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. </sense><sense id="n36420.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a fishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">catching of fish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hamatilis et saxatilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 6</bibl> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">esse et in piscatu voluptatem maxime testudinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 22, 24, § 91</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos venatus, aucupia, piscatusque alebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 17, § 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36420.2" n="II" level="1"> Fig., <hi rend="ital">a catch</hi> (of a mistress): <cit><quote lang="la">piscatus hic tibi evenit bonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 70</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr., <hi rend="ital">fishes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parare piscatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">privare piscatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: inopia tum erat piscati, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 1</bibl>. 1.: omne piscati genus, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 1</bibl>. 1.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:8:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 8, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
piscicapus: <entryFree id="n36421" type="gloss" key="pisci^ca^pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">piscĭcăpus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>piscis-capio</etym>, <sense id="n36421.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fish-catcher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fisher</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3700</bibl>, c.</sense></entryFree>
pisciculus: <entryFree id="n36422" type="main" key="pisci^cu^lus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">piscĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>piscis</etym>, <sense id="n36422.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">minuti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:48:123" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 48, 123</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 8, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36423" type="main" key="Pisci^cu^lus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Piscĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Junius Pisciculus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
piscina: <entryFree id="n36424" type="main" key="pisci_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">piscīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>piscis</etym>, <sense id="n36424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pond in which fish are kept</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fish-pond.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36424.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscinarum genera sunt duo, dulcium et salsarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:17:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 17, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:3:2" default="NO">3, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:5" default="NO">5</bibl>; 10; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:21" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17" default="NO">8, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in piscinam rete qui parat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:2:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 5, 2, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 1, 7</bibl>.—Esp., </sense><sense id="n36424.2" n="2" level="3"> Piscina publica, <hi rend="ital">the public fish-pond at the</hi> Porta Capena: <cit><quote lang="la">praetores tribunalia ad Piscinam publicam posuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 32, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. Fest. infra, II. A. —</sense><sense id="n36424.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n36424.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A pond for bathing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">swimming</hi>, whether of warm or cold water; <hi rend="ital">a basin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pool</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohaeret calida piscina, ex quā natantes mare aspiciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 2:17:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 17, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 86:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 86, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 19</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">piscinam peto, non licet natare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:44:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 44, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,031:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Cant. 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Johan. 5, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscinae publicae hodieque nomen manet, ipsa non exstat, ad quam et natatum et exercitationis alioqui causā veniebat populus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=213" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 213</bibl></cit> Müll.—Of a pond where cattle might bathe and drink: <cit><quote lang="la">piscinae pecoribus instruantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:21" default="NO">1, 6, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36424.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A flood-gate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sluice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lock</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 53</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36424.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A cistern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tank</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reservoir</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscinae ligneae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 12, 32, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Probatica piscina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 5, 2</bibl></cit>. <cb n="PISI" /></sense></entryFree>
piscinalis: <entryFree id="n36425" type="main" key="pisci_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">piscīnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>piscina</etym>, <sense id="n36425.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a bath</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cellae,</quote> <trans><tr>bathing-rooms</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 40, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
piscinarius: <entryFree id="n36426" type="main" key="pisci_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">piscīnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36426.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to fish-ponds</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">macellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 17</bibl></cit> ex conject. Ponted.; v. Schneid. ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n36426.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">piscīnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one fond of fish-ponds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 19, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 20, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
piscinensis: <entryFree id="n36427" type="main" key="pisci_nensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">piscīnensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36427.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to fish-ponds</hi>: pugil est, Lucil. ap. Fest. s. v. piscinae, p. 213 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
piscis: <entryFree id="n36428" type="main" key="piscis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">piscis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>etym. dub.; cf. Angl. -Sax. fisk, Germ. Fisch</etym>, <sense id="n36428.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fish.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36428.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: ubi lanigerum pecus piscibus pascit, Enn. ap. Paul. ex Fest. s. v. cyprio, p. 59 Müll. (Sat. v. 42 Vahl.); id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 299</bibl> (Heduph. v. 5 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 3, 1</bibl>: pisces ut saepe minutos magnu' comest, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 81, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">etsi pisces ut aiunt, ova cum genuerunt, relinquunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:51:129" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 51, 129</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 3, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:72" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 72</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36428.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Sing. collect.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisce vehi quaedam (natarum videntur),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 53, 116, § 281</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus piscem suggerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">piscis femina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:482" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 482</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36428.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, as a constellation. </sense><sense id="n36428.4" n="A" level="2"> Pisces, <hi rend="ital">the Fishes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a constellation consisting of</hi> 34 <hi rend="ital">stars.</hi> Acc. to the myth, <hi rend="ital">Cupid and Venus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">during the war of the Titans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">were carried for safety across the Euphrales by fishes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who were on this account placed among the stars</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:458" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 458</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:30" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:3:29" default="NO">3, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:24" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:63" default="NO">63</bibl>; cf. nodus, I. B. 7.—</sense><sense id="n36428.5" n="B" level="2"> Piscis major, <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 806</bibl>. Prob. the same constellation, in the southern heavens, which <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 234</bibl>, calls Piscis aquosus; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 428</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
piscor: <entryFree id="n36429" type="main" key="piscor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">piscor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n36429.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [piscis], <hi rend="ital">to fish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ante suos hortulos piscarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:14:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 14, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscemur, venemur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi laxandi causā piscabatur hamo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:83" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscatus est rete aurato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retia in piscando durantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 2, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vado piscari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 21, 3</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">piscari in aëre,</quote> <trans><tr>to give one's self useless trouble</tr>, <tr>to labor in vain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 86</bibl></cit>: piscari aureo hamo, <hi rend="ital">to risk more than the game is worth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">minima commoda non minimo sectantis discrimine similes aiebat esse aureo hamo piscantibus, cujus abrupti damnum nullā capturā pensari potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
piscosus: <entryFree id="n36430" type="main" key="pisco_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">piscōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36430.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of fishes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abounding in fish</hi> (syn. pisculentus): amnes. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:581" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 581</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scopuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:7:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oceanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:1:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 44, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pisculentus: <entryFree id="n36431" type="main" key="piscu^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">piscŭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36431.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of fishes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abounding in fish</hi> (ante- and postclass.): fluvius, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 151, 7 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promuntorium omnibus mari nantibus pisculentissimum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 5, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36431.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">piscŭlentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a remedy prepared from fish</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 294, 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pisida: <entryFree id="n36432" type="main" key="Pi_^si_^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pī^sī^da</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36432.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Pisidian;</hi> usually <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pī^sī^dae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype> (old orthog. Peisidae, Plebis. Therm.), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pisi/dai</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Pisidians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a people of Taurus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Asia Minor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bordering on the Phrygians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:13:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 13, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 15, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 41, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 2, 241</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:47:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 47, 105</bibl>.—Collect.: <cit><quote lang="la">Pisida ferox,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 1023</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n36432.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pī^sī^dĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pisidi/a</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Pisidians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pisidia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 54</bibl> and 56.—</sense><sense id="n36432.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pī^sī^dĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pisidian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 7, 19, § 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pisinnus: <entryFree id="n36433" type="main" key="pi^sinnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭsinnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n36433.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">little;</hi> only as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭsinni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">little ones</hi>, <hi rend="ital">children</hi>: crudum manduces Priamum Priamique pisinnos, Labeo ap. Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:4" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pisinuus: <entryFree id="n36434" type="main" key="Pisi^nu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pisĭnŭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n36434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient town in Galatia</hi>, prob. the same with Pessinus (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*pessinou=s</foreign>), q. v., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 42, § 146</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pisistratus: <entryFree id="n36435" type="main" key="Pi_sistra^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīsistrătus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*peisi/stratos</foreign>. <sense id="n36435.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pisistratus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tyrant of Athens</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:33:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 33, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:7:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 7, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:44:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 44, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:34:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 34, 137</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:11:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 2, 5</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36435.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīsistrătĭdae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*peisistrati/dai</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the Pisistratidœ</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Hippias and Hipparchus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sons of Pisistratus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:44:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 44, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36435.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Bœotian chief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a friend of the Romans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:27 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 27 sq.</bibl> <cb n="PIST" /></sense></entryFree>
pisito: <entryFree id="n36436" type="main" key="pi_si^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīsĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n36436.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to utter the natural cry of the starling</hi>, Auct. Carm. Phil. 17.</sense></entryFree>
piso: <entryFree id="n36437" type="main" key="pi_so1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīso</orth>, <itype>āre and ĕre</itype>, v. pinso.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36438" type="main" key="pi_so2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīso</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pinso, piso; cf. pistor</etym>, <sense id="n36438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mortar</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmoreus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Emp. 8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Emp. 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36439" type="main" key="Pi_so3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīso</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname in the</hi> gens Calpurnia; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Calpurnius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 13, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:109" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 109</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36439.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīsōnĭ-ānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Piso</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pisonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pisoniana conjuratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 36</bibl></cit>: Pisoniano vitio, cum loqui nesciret, tacere non potuit (with reference to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 1, 1</bibl>, where Cicero charges Piso with lack of eloquence), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 69, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pissasphaltus: <entryFree id="n36440" type="greek" key="pissasphaltus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pissasphaltus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pissa/sfaltos</foreign>, <sense id="n36440.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">earth-pitch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pissasphalt</hi> (<hi rend="ital">a kind of soft bitumen</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 7, 25, § 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:178" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 15, 51, § 178</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pisselaeon: <entryFree id="n36441" type="greek" key="pisse^laeon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pissĕlaeon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pisse/laion</foreign>, <sense id="n36441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an oil made from the resin of the cedar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 5, 11, § 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pissinus: <entryFree id="n36442" type="greek" key="pissi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pissĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">pissinos</foreign>, <sense id="n36442.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of pitch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pitch-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">e pice fit (oleum) quod pissinum appellant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 7, 7, § 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:96" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 4, 50, § 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:55" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 5, 22, § 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pissoceros: <entryFree id="n36443" type="greek" key="pisso^ce_ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pissŏcēros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pisso/khros</foreign>, <sense id="n36443.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pitch-wax</hi>, <hi rend="ital">work of pitch and wax</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the second foundation of the honey-comb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima fundamenta commosin vocant periti, secunda pissoceron, tertia propolin,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 7, 6, § 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pistacia: <entryFree id="n36444" type="greek" key="pista_ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pistācĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pistaki/a</foreign>, <sense id="n36444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pistachio-tree</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 25, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
