pistacium: <entryFree id="n36445" type="greek" key="pista_ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pistācĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pistācĕum</orth>,, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pista/kion</foreign>, <sense id="n36445.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the fruit of the pistachiotree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pistachio-nut</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 5, 10, § 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 11, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Insit. 157</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pistana: <entryFree id="n36446" type="main" key="pista_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pistāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, for sagitta, <sense id="n36446.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrow-head</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 17, 68, § 111</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pisticus: <entryFree id="n36447" type="greek" key="pisti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pistĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">pistiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">genuine</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 12, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 6, § 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pistillum: <entryFree id="n36448" type="main" key="pistillum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pistillum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pistillus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36448.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pounder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pestle</hi> of a mortar, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 2, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen sinapis in mortarium conicito et pistillis conterito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:55" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 18, 50, § 169</bibl>: pistillum grande est, Auct. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 221, 5</bibl> (yet pastillum appears to be the more correct reading).</sense></entryFree>
pisto: <entryFree id="n36449" type="main" key="pisto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pisto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>piso, pinso</etym>, <sense id="n36449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pound</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba senecion pistatā cum axungiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 75</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pistolochia: <entryFree id="n36450" type="main" key="pisto^lo^chi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pistŏlŏchĭa</orth>, v. plistolochia.</entryFree>
pistor: <entryFree id="n36451" type="main" key="pistor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pistor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pinso; root in Sanscr. pish-, to crush; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pti/ssw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n36451.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who pounds corn in a mortar</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grinds it in a hand-mill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a miller</hi> (only so in Plaut.). </sense><sense id="n36451.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: nec pistorem ullum nossent, nisi eum, qui in pistrino pinseret farinam (far?), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 152, 14</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16</bibl>: pistores tantum eos qui far pinserunt nominatos, At. Cap. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 28, § 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36451.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a baker</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pistores Romae non fuere ad Persicum usque bellum ... ipsi panem faciebant Quirites, mulierum id opus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 28, § 107</bibl></cit>: ut tuus pistor bonum faceret panem, etc., Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:19:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 19, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitto hasce artes vulgares, coquos, pistores, lecticarios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:46:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 46, 134</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:8:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 8, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:46:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 46, 134</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 15:3:24" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 15, 3, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:40:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 40, 1</bibl>. At Rome the bakers formed a separate guild, Inscr. Don. cl. 9, n. 11; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 81, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">255, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:4:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:1:46" default="NO">27, 1, 46</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36451.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A surname of Jupiter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">because</hi>, <hi rend="ital">when the Romans were besieged in the Capitol</hi>, <hi rend="ital">he gave them the idea of hurling bread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as though they had an abundance of it</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the besieging Gauls</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:350" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 350</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">394</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36451.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pastry-cooks</hi> were also called pistores, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:31:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 31, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:222" default="NO">14, 222</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pistoricus: <entryFree id="n36452" type="spur" key="pisto_ri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pistōrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um, a false reading for pistorius</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:73 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 73 al.</bibl></entryFree>
pistorium: <entryFree id="n36453" type="main" key="Pisto_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pistōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n36453.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Etruria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where Catiline was defeated and slain</hi>, the modern <hi rend="ital">Pistoia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 52</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36453.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pistōriensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pistorium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pistorian</hi>: ager. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 57:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 57, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites Pistorienses, with a play upon the word pistor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pistorius: <entryFree id="n36454" type="main" key="pisto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pistōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pistor</etym>, <sense id="n36454.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a baker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">baker's</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus pistorium,</quote> <trans><tr>pastry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 27, § 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:73 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 73 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:40:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 40, 17</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1381" /> <cb n="PITH" /></sense></entryFree>
pistriger: <entryFree id="n36455" type="main" key="pistri^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pistrĭger</orth>, <itype>gĕra, gĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pistrisgero</etym>, <sense id="n36455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">whale-bearing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Triton,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>carrying a whale's body</tr>, <tr>ending in a whale's tail</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pistrilla: <entryFree id="n36456" type="main" key="pistrilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pistrilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>pistrina</etym>, <sense id="n36456.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little pounding-mill</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pistrina: <entryFree id="n36457" type="main" key="pistri_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pistrīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pistor</etym>, <sense id="n36457.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bakehouse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bakery</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 9, 20, § 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:167" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 8, 52, § 167</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:31:138" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 31, 138</bibl>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 55</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
pistrinalis: <entryFree id="n36458" type="main" key="pistri_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pistrīnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pistrina</etym>, <sense id="n36458.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a bakery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecus,</quote> <trans><tr>swine fattened there</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 9, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pistrinarius: <entryFree id="n36459" type="main" key="pistri_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pistrīnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pistrinum</etym>, <sense id="n36459.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the manager of a pounding-mill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a miller</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:3:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pistrinensis: <entryFree id="n36460" type="main" key="pistri_nensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pistrīnensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36460.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a pounding-mill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mill-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pistrinum: <entryFree id="n36461" type="main" key="pistri_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pistrīnum</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">pristrīnum</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 15</bibl> Ritschl; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 9</bibl> Fleck.), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pistor</etym>, <sense id="n36461.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place where corn is pounded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pounding-mill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mill;</hi> usually worked by horses or asses; but sometimes a lazy or otherwise bad slave was forced to perform this labor (cf. mola). </sense><sense id="n36461.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ferratus in pistrino aetatem conteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pistrinum tradi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pristrino credo, ut convenit fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te in pistrinum, Dave, dedam usque ad necem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratorem in judicium, tamquam in aliquod pistrinum, detrudi et compingi videbam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:11:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 11, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 42</bibl>.—As a term of reproach, of bad slaves: <cit><quote lang="la">pristrinorum civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36461.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36461.3" n="A" level="2"> Because bread was usually baked at the mill, <hi rend="ital">a bakery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercere pistrinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in pistrinum submittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:22" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 22</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">swine were fed there upon the bran,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36461.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A wearisome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oppressive labor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drudgery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi mecum in eodem est pistrino, Crasse, vivendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:33:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 33, 144</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pistris: <entryFree id="n36462" type="greek" key="pistris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pistris</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">pristis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">pistrix</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">pristix</orth>, ĭcis), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pi/stris, pri/stis</foreign>. <sense id="n36462.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">any sea-monster; a whale</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sawfish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postrema immani corpore pistrix (of Scylla),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:427" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 427</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Indico mari pristes ducenum cubitorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 3, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamque agmine toto Pistris adest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:530" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 530</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marina pistrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:5:16" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 5, 16</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n36462.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36462.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The constellation of the Whale</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Pistricis terga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=152" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Auster Pistrin agit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>German.</author> Arat. 358</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n36462.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A species of swift-sailing ship</hi>, Quadrig. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 535, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 26, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36462.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Name of a ship in the fleet of Æneas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 116</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pistrix: <entryFree id="n36463" type="main" key="pistrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pistrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pistor</etym>, <sense id="n36463.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a woman who pounds corn;</hi> hence, transf., <hi rend="ital">a female baker</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=138" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 138</bibl> Müll., and ap. Fest. s. v. mamphula, p. 142 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
pistura: <entryFree id="n36464" type="main" key="pistu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pistūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pinso</etym>, <sense id="n36464.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pounding</hi> of corn, <hi rend="ital">a grinding</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 10, 23, § 97</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pistus: <entryFree id="n36465" type="main" key="pistus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pistus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from pinso.</entryFree>
pisum: <entryFree id="n36466" type="greek" key="pi_sum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīsum</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (late Lat. collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">pīsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:5:4" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 11, 14</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">piso/n</foreign>, <sense id="n36466.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of leguminous plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the pea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 12, 31, § 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:125" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 12, 33, § 125</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pitane: <entryFree id="n36467" type="main" key="Pi^ta^ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĭtănē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pita/nh</foreign>. <sense id="n36467.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city on the Æolic coast of Asia Minor</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Sandarlik</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:18:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 18, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:357" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 357</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36467.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĭtănaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Pitane</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pitanean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollonius Pitanaeus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 38, § 117</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36467.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Laconia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Eurotas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 8, § 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 24, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pithecium: <entryFree id="n36468" type="greek" key="pi^the_ci^um1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭthēcĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">piqh/kion</foreign>. <sense id="n36468.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little ape</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 42</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36468.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> antirrhinon, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 86</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36469" type="main" key="Pi^the_ci^um2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĭthēcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n36469.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of an attendant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 24</bibl> Speng.‡ † <orth extent="full" lang="la">pithēcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">piqhkos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">an ape</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pithecus, cercopithecus, cercops,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 176</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pithecusa: <entryFree id="n36470" type="main" key="Pi^the_cu_sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĭthēcūsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĭthēcūsae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*piqhkou=sai</foreign>, <sense id="n36470.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island</hi> (prop. <hi rend="ital">the western and larger of two islands;</hi> whence the <number>plur.</number>) <hi rend="ital">in the Tyrrhenian Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not far from Cumœ</hi>, the modern <hi rend="ital">Ischia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:18" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 6, 12, § 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Inarime a Graecis dicta Pithecusa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 644</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pitheus: <entryFree id="n36471" type="greek" key="pi^theus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭtheus</orth>, <itype>ĕi and ĕos</itype> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭthus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <cb n="PIUS" /> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭthĭas</orth>, ae), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">piqeu/s, pi/qos</foreign>, and <foreign lang="greek">pitqias</foreign>, <sense id="n36471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a barrel-shaped comet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 25, 22, § 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:14:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 14, 1</bibl>; App. de Mundo, p. 64.</sense></entryFree>
pitisso: <entryFree id="n36472" type="main" key="pi_tisso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pītisso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. pytisso.</entryFree>
pitpit: <entryFree id="n36473" type="gloss" key="pitpit"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pitpit</orth> <itype>Osce quicquid</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=212" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 212</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
pittacium: <entryFree id="n36474" type="greek" key="pitta^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pittăcĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pitta/kion</foreign>. <sense id="n36474.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little leaf</hi> or <hi rend="ital">slip</hi> of parchment, etc.; <hi rend="ital">a ticket</hi>, <hi rend="ital">label</hi>, on wine-bottles, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">amphorae vitreae, quarum in cervicibus pittacia erant affixa cum hoc titulo: Falernum Opimianum Annorum Centum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 34</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; Cod. Th. 7, 4, 11.— </sense><sense id="n36474.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small piece of linen</hi> or <hi rend="ital">leather spread with salve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a plaster</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 10, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36474.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A patch on a garment</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shoe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calceamenta pittaciis consuta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Josh. 9, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pittacus: <entryFree id="n36475" type="main" key="Pitta^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pittăcus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pittako/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36475.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the seven wise men of Greece</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from Mitylene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Lesbos</hi>, Aus. Sept. Sap.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:15:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 15, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:26:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 26, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:6" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pittheus: <entryFree id="n36476" type="main" key="Pittheus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pittheus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dissyl.</orth>), <itype>ĕi and ĕos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pitqeu/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36476.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">king of Trœzen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Pelops</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and father of Æthra</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the mother of Theseus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:622" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 622</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 37" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 37</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36476.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pitthēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pittheus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pitthean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pitthea Troezen,</quote> <trans><tr>ruled by Pittheus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 296</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">506</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36476.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pit-thēïus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pitthean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Troezen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 418</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">regna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 107</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36476.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pitthēis</orth>, <itype>ĭdos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Pittheïd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Pittheus</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Æthra</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pittheidos Aethrae filius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 131</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pituinus: <entryFree id="n36477" type="greek" key="pi^tu^i^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭtŭĭnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pĭtyĭnus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">pitu/inos</foreign>, <sense id="n36477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from pines</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pine-</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">resina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 202" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 202</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:205" default="NO">205</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 4, 28</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">acc. to the Gr. orthog., resina pityina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pituita: <entryFree id="n36478" type="main" key="pi_tu^i_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pītŭīta</orth> (sometimes in the poets scan. as a trisyl., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 76</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:57" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 57</bibl>; cf. Santen on <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1518,001:page=430" default="NO"><author>Ter. Maur.</author> p. 430</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root pitu- for sputu-, from spu- of spuo, sputum; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ptu/w</foreign>, to spit</etym>, <sense id="n36478.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slime</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clammy moisture.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36478.1" n="I" level="1"> In the body, as diseased matter, <hi rend="ital">phlegm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rheum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pituite;</hi> in fowls, <hi rend="ital">the pip</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sanguis corruptus est aut pituita redundat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:10:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 11, 90, § 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 1, 13, § 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum bilis pituitaeque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus acutas pituitae fluxiones, quas Graeci rheumatismos vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 68, § 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala pituita nasi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:23:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 23, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stomacho tumultum Lenta feret pituita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipue sanus, nisi cum pituita molesta est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 108</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:2:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 2, 4</bibl>.—Of the <hi rend="ital">pip</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:22" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 57, 78, § 157</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36478.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A viscous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gummy moisture that exudes from trees</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 27, 43, § 252</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fungorum origo non nisi ex pituitā arborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 23, 47, § 96</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pituitaria: <entryFree id="n36479" type="main" key="pi_tu^i_ta_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pītŭītārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. herba) [pituita], <sense id="n36479.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an herb that removes phlegm</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 13, § 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pituitosus: <entryFree id="n36480" type="main" key="pi_tu^i_to_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pītŭītōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36480.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of phlegm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">phlegmatic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pituilous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:4:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 4, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pitydion: <entryFree id="n36481" type="main" key="pitydion"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pitydion</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, a reading in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 10, 9, § 36</bibl>; v. pityis.</entryFree>
pityida: <entryFree id="n36482" type="main" key="pi^ty^i^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭtyĭda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = pityis (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:29:160" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 29, 160</bibl>.</entryFree>
pityinus: <entryFree id="n36483" type="main" key="pi^ty^i^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭtyĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. pituinus.</entryFree>
pityis: <entryFree id="n36484" type="main" key="pi^ty^is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭtyis</orth>, <itype>ĭdos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pitui/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pine-cone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 10, 9, § 36</bibl> (al. pitydion).</sense></entryFree>
pityocampa: <entryFree id="n36485" type="greek" key="pi^ty^o^campa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭtyŏcampa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pituoka/mph</foreign>, <sense id="n36485.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the pine-grub</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pine-caterpillar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 9, 4, § 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:128" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 9, 33, § 128</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pitysma: <entryFree id="n36486" type="main" key="pi_tysma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pītysma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, v. pytisma.</entryFree>
pius: <entryFree id="n36487" type="main" key="pi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭus</orth> (written PIIVS, Inscr. Viscont. Monum. Degli Scip. tab. 6, n. 1; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 1, 4, 11</bibl>), a, um (<case>voc.</case> pie: <sense id="n36487.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">o crucifer bone, lucisator Omnipotens pie,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> only magis pius; cf. Charis. pp. 88 and 130 P.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">piissimus, used by Antonius, and condemned by Cicero, as: verbum omnino nullum in linguā Latinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:19:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 19, 43</bibl></cit>; but freq. in the post-Aug. per., e. g. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 4:27" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 4, 27 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Consol. ad Polyb. 26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Consol. ad Polyb. 26 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:6:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 6, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:7:15" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 7, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 418</bibl> et saep. From rare form PIENS, found in inscriptions, Murat. 1624, 4; Mus. Ver. 129, 3 Maff., is derived another form of the <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, PIENTISSIMVS, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 200</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">203</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3592</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; often referred to <foreign lang="greek">ti/w, tima/w</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">that acts according to duty</hi>, <cb n="PLAC" /> <hi rend="ital">dutiful;</hi> esp. that performs what is due to the gods and religion in general, to parrents, kindred, teachers, country; <hi rend="ital">pious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conscientious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affectionate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grateful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respectful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loyal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">patriotic</hi>, etc. (of persons and things): <cit><quote lang="la">si quis pius est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxor pia et pudica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 5, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: Capus ... pium ex se Anchisen generat, Enn. ap. Philarg. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 35</bibl> (Ann. v. 31 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">(deos) piorum et impiorum habere rationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:7:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 7, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:15:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 15, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">di meliora piis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:513" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 513</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 16, 5</bibl></cit>: pii vates. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:662" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 662</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pio vatis ab ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:326" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 326</bibl></cit>.—So as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> freq. <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭi</orth>, of <hi rend="ital">the departed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the blessed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">piorum sedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva piorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 62</bibl></cit>: cf. Bentley on <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 6</bibl>.—Of things having reference to religion: <cit><quote lang="la">far,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:23:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 23, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">21, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">luci,</quote> <trans><tr>sacred</tr>, <tr>holy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pia et aeterna pax,</quote> <trans><tr>a conscientiously kept and eternal peace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:16:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 16, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Poeni homines immolare pium esse duxerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:2:96" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 2, 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ore pio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 172</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">quosque pium est adhibere deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:829" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 829</bibl></cit>.— As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabit pro signis jusque piumque tuis,</quote> <trans><tr>justice and equity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 200</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 8, 4</bibl>.—Of respectful, affectionate conduct towards parents, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">pius in parentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:23:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 23, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pius Aeneas, on account of his filial love for Anchises,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 220</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">305</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">378</bibl>; 4, 393; 5, 26 et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">seniorque parens, pia sarcina nati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 107</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:482" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 482</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pius dolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 2</bibl></cit>: impietate pia est, <hi rend="ital">she is affectionate</hi> (towards her brothers) <hi rend="ital">through want of affection</hi> (for her son), <hi rend="ital">her sisterly triumphed over her maternal love</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:477" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 477</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo pius affectu Castora frater amat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:5:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 5, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metus,</quote> <trans><tr>of a wife for her husband</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 389</bibl></cit>: bellum, <hi rend="ital">waged for one's country</hi> or <hi rend="ital">allies</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:36" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:162" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 162</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36487.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen. </sense><sense id="n36487.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Honest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honorable</hi> (very rare): pius quaestus, Cato, R. R. praef.— </sense><sense id="n36487.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Benevolent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gentle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gracious</hi> (postAug.): clementia patrem tuum in primis Pii nomine ornavit, M. Aurel. ap. Vulcat. Gallic. in Av<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:Cass. 11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cass. 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pius enim et clemens es, Dominus Deus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:30:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 30, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ecclus. 2, 13</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĭus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a title of the emperors after M. Antoninus</hi>, on coins and inscrr.; v. Eckh. D. N. 7, p. 36; 8, p. 453; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 840 sq.</bibl>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of a wine-jar: testa, <hi rend="ital">my kindly jar</hi>, = benigna, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 21, 4</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">piously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">religiously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dutifully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affectionately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pie sancteque colere deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 20, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 17, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriam nostri pie inviolateque servabitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:22:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 22, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metuo ne scelerate dicam in te, quod pro Milone dicam pie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:38:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 38, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pie lugere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:40:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 40, 167</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 153</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod utrumque piissime tulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Polyb. 34:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Polyb. 34, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pix: <entryFree id="n36488" type="main" key="pix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pix</orth>, <itype>pĭcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>akin to Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pikro/s</foreign>, bitter, <foreign lang="greek">pi/tus</foreign>, pine; cf. <foreign lang="greek">peu/kh</foreign></etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">pi/ssa</foreign>, <sense id="n36488.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pitch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">picem meminisse debemus non aliud esse quam combustae resinae fluxum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 24, § 47</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 11, 21, § 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">postes inducti pice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastor junctis pice cantat avenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:10:25" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic dies festus Corticem astrictum pice dimovebit Amphorae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum pice nigrius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18, 7</bibl></cit>.—Boiling pitch was poured on the bodies of slaves as a punishment: <cit><quote lang="la">te Pix atra agitet aput carnificem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1017" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1017</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Idaeasque pices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:450" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 450</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 20, 25, § 122</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut pices navium solverentur, Aug. Civ. Dei, 3, 31.— Prov.: Qui tetigerit picem inquinabitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 13, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
placabilis: <entryFree id="n36489" type="main" key="pla_ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plācābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>placo</etym>. <sense id="n36489.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">easy to be pacified</hi>, <hi rend="ital">easily appeased</hi>, <hi rend="ital">placable</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">inimicis te placabilem, amicis inexorabilem praebes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 15, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 45, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: ut eo placabiliorem praebeas, Anton. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 13</bibl>, A <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia habuisset aequiora et placabiliora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:38:section=95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 38, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">que quisque est major, magis est placabilis ira (al. irae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:5:31" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 5, 31</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hortensii tam placabile ad justas preces ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:42:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 42, 9</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ara Dianae,</quote> <trans><tr>placable</tr>, <tr>mild</tr>, <tr>gentle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:764" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 764</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ara Palici,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 585</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36489.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pacifying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appeasing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moderating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pro</hi> <pb n="1382" /> <cb n="PLAC" /> <hi rend="ital">pitiating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acceptable</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">te ipsum purgare ipsis coram placabilius est,</quote> <trans><tr>is more fitted to appease</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 3, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si una hostia placabilis, placabiliores utique hostiae plures,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 28, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrificium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Epit. 67, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 5, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">plācābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soothingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appeasingly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
placabilitas: <entryFree id="n36490" type="main" key="pla_ca_bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plācābĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>placabilis</etym>, <sense id="n36490.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">readiness to be appeased</hi>, <hi rend="ital">placable disposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">placability</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil magno et praeclaro viro dignius placabilitate atque clementiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 25, 88</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
placabiliter: <entryFree id="n36491" type="main" key="pla_ca_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plācābĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. placabilis <sense id="n36491.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
placamen: <entryFree id="n36492" type="main" key="pla_ca_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plācāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>placo</etym>, <sense id="n36492.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a means of pacifying</hi> or <hi rend="ital">appeasing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lenitive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelestis irae placamina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duc praedicta sacris duro placamina Diti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:415" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 415</bibl></cit>; cf. placamentum.</sense></entryFree>
placamentum: <entryFree id="n36493" type="main" key="pla_ca_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plācāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36493.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a means of pacifying</hi> or <hi rend="ital">appeasing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lenitive</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">hoc veluti placamento terrae blandiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 7, 19, § 42</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">deŭm placamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 63</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
placate: <entryFree id="n36494" type="main" key="pla_ca_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plācātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. placo, <sense id="n36494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
placatio: <entryFree id="n36495" type="main" key="pla_ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plācātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>placo</etym>, <sense id="n36495.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pacifying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appeasing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propitiating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum immortalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:28:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 28, 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
placatorius: <entryFree id="n36496" type="main" key="pla_ca_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plācātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to pacifying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appeasing</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">propitiating; appeasing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">placatory</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">hostia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Patient. 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
placatrix: <entryFree id="n36497" type="main" key="pla_ca_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plācātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id. through placator; not in use</etym>, <sense id="n36497.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that appeases</hi> or <hi rend="ital">propitiates</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">dei (ecclesia),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> Gub. D. 3, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
placatus: <entryFree id="n36498" type="main" key="pla_ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plācātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from placo.</entryFree>
placens: <entryFree id="n36499" type="main" key="pla^cens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plăcens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from placeo.</entryFree>
placenta: <entryFree id="n36500" type="main" key="pla^centa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plăcenta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">plakou=s</foreign>, <sense id="n36500.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cake</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 76</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 8, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:59" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:39:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 39, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:75:1" default="NO">6, 75, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:91:18" default="NO">9, 91, 18</bibl>.—For an offering, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 7, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
placentarius: <entryFree id="n36501" type="main" key="pla^centa_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plăcentārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>placenta</etym>, <sense id="n36501.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pastry-cook</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confectioner</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">inter urbana ministeria continentur ... placentarii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 6, 72</bibl></cit>; cf.: <foreign lang="greek">plakounta/rios</foreign>, placentarius, dulciarius, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
placentia: <entryFree id="n36502" type="main" key="pla^centi^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plăcentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>placeo</etym>, <sense id="n36502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">suavity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courteousness</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 15, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36503" type="main" key="Pla^centi^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Plăcentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n36503.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in</hi> Gallia Cispadana, <hi rend="ital">on the Po</hi>, the modern <hi rend="ital">Piacenza</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:56" default="NO" valid="yes">56</bibl> sq.; 27, 39; 31, 10 al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:14" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:593" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 593</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36503.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Plăcentī-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Placentia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Placentian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Placentine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">municipium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:23:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 23, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calices,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 27, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tinca,</quote> <trans><tr>from Placentia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:46:172" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 46, 172</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Plă-centīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Placentia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Placentines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:21 al" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 21 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n36503.2" n="B" level="2"> In a burlesque double sense: Placentini milites, <hi rend="ital">Placentine soldiers</hi> and <hi rend="ital">placenta</hi> (cake) <hi rend="ital">soldiers</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">pastry-cooks</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
placeo: <entryFree id="n36504" type="main" key="pla^ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plăcĕo</orth>, <itype>cŭi and cĭtus, cĭtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> (<sense id="n36504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part. fut. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dos placenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 35</bibl></cit>; v. I. A. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>) [cf. placo], <hi rend="ital">to please</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be pleasing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">agreeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be welcome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acceptable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to satisfy</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n36504.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36504.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ungor ut illi placeam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meo neque cara'st cordi neque placet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si placeo, utere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non placet Antonio consulatus meus: at placuit P. Servilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 34</bibl>: et quae vobis placita est condicio, datur. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec dubito, quin mihi (Erigona) placitura sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:4:section=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 4, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspecto quid illis placeat de epistolā ad Caesarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi Ne Enipeus Plus justo placeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dis, quibus septem placuere colles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> C. S. 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 17, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid placet aut odio est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod spiro et placeo (si placeo) tuum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 3, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 7, 14, § 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi non placere, quod (Aristides) cupide elaborasset, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Arist. 1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Arist. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis gener hic placuit censu minor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:160" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deo placere non possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 8, 8</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si illa tibi placet, placenda dos quoque'st quam dat tibi,</quote> <trans><tr>must be pleasing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36504.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n36504.4" n="1" level="3"> In scenic lang., of players or <cb n="PLAC" /> pieces presented, <hi rend="ital">to please</hi>, <hi rend="ital">find favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give satisfaction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo actu placeo, Ter. Hec. prol. alt. 31: cui scenico placenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">populo ut placerent quas fecisset fabulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:prol. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. prol. 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">id. Hec. prol. alt. 12: ubi (fabulae) sunt cognitae, Placitae sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36504.5" n="2" level="3"> Placere sibi, <hi rend="ital">to be pleased</hi> or <hi rend="ital">satisfied with one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to flatter one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pride</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plume one's self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego numquam mihi minus quam hesterno die placui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolo tibi tam valde placeas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 126</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 9, 36, § 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu tibi tunc curruca places,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:276" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 276</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes competitores placebant sibi, omnes omnibus displicebant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36504.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: placet mihi (tibi, etc.), or simply placet, <hi rend="ital">it pleases me</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it seems good</hi>, <hi rend="ital">right</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">proper to me; it is my opinion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I am of opinion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I hold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">believe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purpose;</hi> and in <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, placuit, or placitum est, <hi rend="ital">it is decided</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resolved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">determined</hi> (mihi, nobis, etc., or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>). </sense><sense id="n36504.7" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n36504.8" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ipsi auctori hujus disciplinae placet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:9:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 9, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut doctissimis sapientissimisque placuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:49:110" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 49, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postea mihi placuit, ut summorum oratorum Graecas orationes explicarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:34:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 34, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita nobis placitum est, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic Justitiae placitumque Parcis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:17:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 17, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si placitum hoc Superis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:296" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 296</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo placet esse Carneadi genera visorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 31, 99</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:38:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 38, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic visum Veneri, cui placet impares Formas, etc., mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:33:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 33, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis paria esse fere placuit peccata, laborant, Cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 3, 96</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36504.9" n="(b)" level="5"> Without <case>dat.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:46:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 46, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed, si placet, in hunc diem hactenus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 44, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">placitum est, ut in aprico maxime pratuli loco considerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:12:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 12, 18</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">neutr. pron.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hocine placet?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 16</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">placuit ad hunc primum ferremus aditum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, 9</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">placet enim esse quiddam in re publicā praestans et regale, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:45:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 45, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 36, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si enim pecunias aequari non placet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 32, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos corripi placitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 96</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36504.10" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n36504.11" n="1" level="3"> In publicists' lang., <hi rend="ital">to resolve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">determine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatui placere, ut C. Pansa, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:14:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 14, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatui placere, C. Cassium, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deliberatur de Avarico in communi concilio, incendi placeret an defendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamobrem placitum est mihi, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 12</bibl></cit>, A, § <cit><quote lang="la">4: edixit, mulieres ante horam quintam venire in theatrum non placere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid placeat, die,</quote> <trans><tr>your decision</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:338" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 338</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36504.12" n="2" level="3"> Si dis placet, <hi rend="ital">please the gods;</hi> and in eccl. writers: <cit><quote lang="la">Deo placere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:23:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 23, 27</bibl></cit>; v. deus.— Hence, * </sense><sense id="n36504.13" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">plăcens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">pleasing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">expetendum esse quod non placens sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placens uxor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 14, 21</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Acceptable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostia placens Deo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,011:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Phil. 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi placentes,</quote> <trans><tr>self-willed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2</bibl></cit> Pet. 2, 10.—</sense><sense id="n36504.14" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">plăcĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">pleasing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agreeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acceptable</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">placita es simplicitate tuā,</quote> <trans><tr>you are pleasing</tr>, <tr>you please</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oliva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:425" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 425</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in locum ambobus placitum exercitus conveniunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 81:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 81, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum (regem creari) quasi placitissimum diis. qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 18</bibl></cit>. 3. 9 (the reading acceptissimum is a later emendation).—<hi rend="ital">Abl. absol.</hi>: sic placito ocius surrexit. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">placiti dies,</quote> <trans><tr>appointed days</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 13, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36504.15" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">plăcĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n36504.16" n="a" level="4"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">that which is pleasing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">agreeable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultra placitum laudare,</quote> <trans><tr>more than is agreeable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36504.17" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36504.18" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">An opinion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sentiment</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Catonis placita de olivis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 5, 6, § 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36504.19" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A determination</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prescription</hi>, <hi rend="ital">order</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicorum placita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 22, 28, § 143</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36504.20" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A maxim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">principle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse (Rubellius) placita majorum colebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientium placita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stoicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec est quare hoc inter nostra placita mireris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66:45" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 66, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decreta, quae Graeci vocant dogmata, nobis vel decreta licet adpellare vel scita vel placita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 10</bibl></cit>: philosophiae<cb n="PLAC" />  placita, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § <cit><quote lang="la">37: Babyloniorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 79, 81, § 191</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:2:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 2, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
placibilis: <entryFree id="n36505" type="main" key="pla^ci^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plăcĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>placeo</etym>, <sense id="n36505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can please</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasing</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Resurr. Carn. 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
placide: <entryFree id="n36506" type="main" key="pla^ci^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plăcĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. placidus <sense id="n36506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
placideianus: <entryFree id="n36507" type="main" key="Pla^ci^de_ia_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Plăcĭdēiānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. Pacideianus.</entryFree>
placiditas: <entryFree id="n36508" type="main" key="pla^ci^di^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plăcĭdĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>placidus</etym>, <sense id="n36508.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mildness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gentleness of nature</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">placidity</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">oves assumptas propter placiditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1</bibl></cit>; Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:22:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 22, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
placido: <entryFree id="n36509" type="main" key="pla^ci^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plăcĭdo</orth>, <itype>āvi, āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36509.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to soothe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calm</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">cursus suos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Virg. 3</bibl></cit>; id. de Cain et Abel, 1, 3, 11; id. Jac. et Vit. Beat. 2, 6, 28.</sense></entryFree>
