placidulus: <entryFree id="n36510" type="main" key="pla^ci^du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plăcĭdŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n36510.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">gentle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">still</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cinis placidula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Parent. 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
placidus: <entryFree id="n36511" type="main" key="pla^ci^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plăcĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>placeo, qs. pleasing, mild; hence</etym>, <sense id="n36511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gentle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">still</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mild</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peaceful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">placid</hi> (class.; syn.: quietus, mollis, lenis). </sense><sense id="n36511.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n36511.2" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">clemens, placidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reddere aliquem placidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 3, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36511.3" n="B" level="2"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:667" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 667</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placidus et serenus dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1004" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1004</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:702" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 702</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placida quietaque constantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:5:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placida ac lenis senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:5:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:43:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 43, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:522" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 522</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:185" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quidquam magnum est nisi quod simul placidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:21:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">re placidā atque otiosā,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in quiet times</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 56</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil illis placidius, aut quietius erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca placidiora,</quote> <trans><tr>less visited with unfavorable weather</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">placidissima pax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:16:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 16, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus placidissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 78</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n36511.4" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n36511.5" n="A" level="2"> Of fruits, <hi rend="ital">ripe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mellow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uva,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 1, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36511.6" n="B" level="2"> Of plants, trees, etc., <hi rend="ital">not wild</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruitful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores placidiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 5, 6, § 16</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">plă-cĭdē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">softly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quietly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calmly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peacefully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">placidly</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">forem aperire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placide volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propere hoc, non placide decet (sc. agi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ire,</quote> <trans><tr>gently</tr>, <tr>lightly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">progredi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placide et sedate ferre dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:24:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 24, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placide et sedate loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:27:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 27, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placide et benigne verba facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 102:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 102, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placide et comiter (inquit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:1:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 1, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebem in magistratu placidius tractare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 39, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">placidissime respondit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 6:1" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 6, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
placitis: <entryFree id="n36512" type="greek" key="pla^ci_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plăcītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">plaki=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n36512.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of calamine produced in a furnace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 10, 22, § 102</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
placito: <entryFree id="n36513" type="hapax" key="pla^ci^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plăcĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n36513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [placeo], <hi rend="ital">to be very pleasing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque placitant mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 10, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
placitum: <entryFree id="n36514" type="main" key="pla^ci^tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plăcĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. <itype>placeo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> B. 2.</entryFree>
placitus: <entryFree id="n36515" type="main" key="pla^ci^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plăcĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from placeo.</entryFree>
placivus: <entryFree id="n36516" type="gloss" key="pla^ci_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plăcīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>placeo</etym>, <sense id="n36516.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pleasing</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">a)resto/s</foreign>, placivus, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
placo: <entryFree id="n36517" type="main" key="pla_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plāco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; cf.: placeo, planus</etym>. <sense id="n36517.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To reconcile;</hi> constr. <hi rend="ital">alicui</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aliquem</hi> (class. and freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">agedum, fac, illa ut placetur nobis,</quote> <trans><tr>that she be reconciled to us</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vereor ut placari possit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 8, 72</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">redigam vos in gratiam, v. 73): coeperas eum mihi placare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogavit ut te sibi placarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his vocibus cum in se magis incitarent dictatorem quam magistro equitum placarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 33, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibalem pater filio meo potui placare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placare aliquem rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 8, 17</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae fuit eorum tanta iniquitas, ut placari populo Romano non possent?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:6:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque nullam spem habebat, patrem sibi placari posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 20, 5</bibl></cit>.—In mid. force; usually with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: numquam animo placari potuit in eum, <hi rend="ital">be reconciled</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">consent to a reconciliation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 5, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,011:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Iph. 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo quietus et sibi ipsi placatus,</quote> <trans><tr>at peace with himself</tr>, <tr>tranquil</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:17:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 17, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36517.1" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soothe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assuage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pacify</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos placare ac lenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placare et mitigare animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: numen deorum immortalium, Caes. B. <pb n="1383" /> <cb n="PLAG" /> G. 6, 15: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem beneficiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iram deorum donis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:9:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">benevolos objurgatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 13</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventos sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hippotades cum vult, aequora placet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 432</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">escā ventrem iratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sitim,</quote> <trans><tr>to quench</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:50:17" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 50, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36517.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To endeavor to appease</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 14, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 64</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">plācātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">soothed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appeased</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calmed; quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gentle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">still</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peaceful</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">animi quietus et placatus status,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:6:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tranquilla, quieta vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:21:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 21, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placidae ac minime turbulentae res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:19:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 19, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultu ac sermone in omnes placato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 32, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">placatiore animo aliquid facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 18, 41, § 83</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quies placatissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:41:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 41, 97</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">plācātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">quietly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calmly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">composedly</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnia humana placate et moderate feramus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 1, 4</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">remissius et placatius ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 13, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
placor: <entryFree id="n36518" type="main" key="pla^cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plăcor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>placeo</etym>, <sense id="n36518.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">contentment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">approval</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satisfaction</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 4, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">39, 23</bibl>; cf.: placor, <foreign lang="greek">a)re/skeia</foreign>, Gloss. Cyrill.</sense></entryFree>
plaetorius: <entryFree id="n36519" type="main" key="Plaeto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Plaetōrĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n36519.1" n="I" level="1"> L. Plaetorius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:60:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 60, 165</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36519.2" n="II" level="1"> M. Plaetorius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:45:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 45, 126</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">53, 147</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 8, 1</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36519.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Plae-tōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Plœtorian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <trans><tr>a law of the tribune of the people</tr>, <tr>Plœtorius</tr>, <tr>for the protection of minors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:2:section=5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> de Die Nat. 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36519.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Plae-tōrĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Plœtorius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Plœtorian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incendium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:20:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 20, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
plaga: <entryFree id="n36520" type="main" key="pla_ga1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plāga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. plango</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">plhgh/</foreign>, <sense id="n36520.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stroke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stripe</hi> (class.; syn.: ictus, verbera, vulnus). </sense><sense id="n36520.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36520.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:51:section=134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 51, § 134</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(pueris) dant animos plagae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 382</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:487" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 487</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:15:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 15, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plagae et vulnera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 7</bibl></cit>.—Of the <hi rend="ital">shock</hi> of atoms striking together, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:20:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 20, 48</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36520.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a blow</hi> which wounds or injures; <hi rend="ital">a stroke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thrust; a wound</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n36520.4" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">plagis costae callent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem irrigatum plagis pistori dabo,</quote> <trans><tr>refreshed by a flogging</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plagas pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plagas perferre,</quote> <trans><tr>to bear</tr>, <tr>receive blows</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:17:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 17, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plagam accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:19:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 19, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plagam mortiferam infligere,</quote> <trans><tr>to inflict a mortal wound</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plaga mediocris pestifera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:24:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 24, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbera et plagas repraesentare,</quote> <trans><tr>stripes and blows</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plagis confectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:54:section=140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 54, § 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagelli plaga livorem facit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 28, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plagam curare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 26, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36520.5" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scorpionum et canum plagas sanare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:H. N. 23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> H. N. 23</bibl></cit> prooem. 3, § 6.—</sense><sense id="n36520.6" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a welt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stripe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam de tergo ducentas plagas praegnatis dabo,</quote> <trans><tr>swollen welts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36520.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36520.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A blow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stroke; an injury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">misfortune</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">illa plaga est injecta petitioni tuae maxima,</quote> <trans><tr>that great blow was given</tr>, <tr>that great obstacle was presented</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:23:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 23, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic nec oratio plagam gravem facit, nisi, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>makes a deep impression</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:68:228" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 68, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levior est plaga ab amico, quam a debitore,</quote> <trans><tr>loss</tr>, <tr>injury</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac ille perculsus plaga non succubuit,</quote> <trans><tr>blow</tr>, <tr>disaster</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36520.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A plague</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pestilence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infection</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">leprae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 13, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:24:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Reg. 24, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36520.10" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An affliction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annoyance</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 7, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caecitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tob. 2, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36520.11" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Slaughter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destruction</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">percussit eos plagā magnā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 23, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Reg. 17, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36521" type="main" key="pla^ga2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plăga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root <foreign lang="greek">plak-</foreign> of Gr. <foreign lang="greek">plakou=s</foreign>; cf. planca, plancus, plānus</etym>. <sense id="n36521.0" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A region</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quarter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tract</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; v. Madv. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:4:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 4, 12</bibl>, where de plagis omnibus is the reading of the best MSS., but pagis of the edd.; but cf. Mütz. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:page=516 sq" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> p. 516 sq.</bibl>; and Krebs, Antibarb. p. 869; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: regio, tractus, terra): aetheria,</quote> <trans><tr>the ethereal regions</tr>, <tr>the air</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:394" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 394</bibl></cit>: caeli scrutantur plagas, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:13:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 13, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et si quem extenta plagarum Quattuor in medio dirimit plaga solis iniqui,</quote> <trans><tr>zones</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardens,</quote> <trans><tr>the torrid zone</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 67" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 67</bibl></cit>; also called fervida, id <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:1219" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1219</bibl>: septentrionalis,<cb n="PLAG" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 32, 59, § 136</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea plaga caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:3:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 42, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad orientis plagam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:37:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 37, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad orientalem plagam,</quote> <trans><tr>on the east</tr>, <tr>in the eastern quarter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 4, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra orientalem plagam urbis, id. Josue, 4, 19: ad septentrionalem plagam collis,</quote> <trans><tr>side</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Judic. 7, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n36521.1" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a region</hi>, <hi rend="ital">district</hi>, <hi rend="ital">canton</hi> (only in Liv.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:41:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 41, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36522" type="main" key="pla^ga3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plăga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root plek-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ple/kw</foreign>, weave, entwine; cf. plecto, plico, du-plex</etym>, <sense id="n36522.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hunting-net</hi>, <hi rend="ital">snare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gin</hi> (class.; syn.: retia, casses). </sense><sense id="n36522.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes compellunt in plagas lupum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tendere plagas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:17:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 17, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extricata densis Cerva plagis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:768" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 768</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nodosae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:110" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inque plagam nullo cervus agente cadit (al. plagas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 428</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut trudit ... Apros in obstantes plagas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:32" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 32</bibl></cit>.—Of the spider's web: <cit><quote lang="la">illa difficile cernuntur, atque ut in plagis liniae offensae praecipitant in sinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 24, 28, § 82</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">sic tu ... tabulam tamquam plagam ponas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:17:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 17, 68</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36522.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a snare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">toil</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. pedica): se impedire in plagas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in plagas conicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas plagas ipsi contra se Stoici texuerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 48, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in illas tibi majores plagas incidendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:58:section=151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 58, § 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antonium conjeci in Caesaris Octaviani plagas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 25, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">speculabor, ne quis nostro consilio venator assit cum auritis plagis, i. e. arrectis attentisque auribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 14</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi> (rare) hanc ergo plagam effugi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 1, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36522.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bedcurtain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a curtain</hi> (ante-class.; v. plagula), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 162, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eburneis lectis et plagis sigillatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 378, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chlamydes, plagae, vela aurea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 537, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
plagella: <entryFree id="n36523" type="main" key="pla^gella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plăgella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. plagula, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:2" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 2</bibl>.</entryFree>
plagiarius: <entryFree id="n36524" type="main" key="pla^gi^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plăgĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>plagium</etym>. <sense id="n36524.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A torturer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oppressor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plunderer</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Licinium plagiarium cum suo pullo milvino tributa exigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:2:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter avaros, circumscriptores, latrones, plagiarios unum esse cui noceri non possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 8:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 8, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36524.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a man-stealer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kidnapper</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:49" default="NO">47, 2, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:53" default="NO">53</bibl>; 48, 15, 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>Callistr.</author> Ib. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Tim. 1, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36524.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a literary thief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plagiarist</hi> (one who pretends to be the author of another's book), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:53:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 53, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plagiaticius: <entryFree id="n36525" type="gloss" key="pla^gi^a_ti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plăgĭātīcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>plagiator</etym>, <sense id="n36525.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a plagiarist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plagiary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plagium, plagiarius, plagiaticius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 80</bibl></cit> (al. plagiaticus).</sense></entryFree>
plagiator:
<entryFree id="n36526" type="main" key="pla^gi^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plăgĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>plagium</etym>, same as plagiarius. <sense id="n36526.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A man-stealer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kidnapper</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 23</bibl>; Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 14, 6, 6.—</sense><sense id="n36526.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A seducer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corrupter</hi> of youth (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 5</bibl>, n. 3.</sense>
‡† <orth extent="full" lang="la">plăgĭaules</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">plagiau/lhs</foreign>, <sense id="n36526.2" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a player on the cross-flute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plagiaules, monaules, axaules,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 173</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
plagiger: <entryFree id="n36527" type="hapax" key="pla_gi^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plāgĭger</orth>, <itype>gĕra, gĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. plagagero</etym>, <sense id="n36527.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stripe-bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">born to be flogged</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genera hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 22</bibl></cit> (Ritschl, ex conj. plagigerula; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art.).</sense></entryFree>
plagigerulus: <entryFree id="n36528" type="main" key="pla_gi^ge^ru^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plāgĭgĕrŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. plagagerulus</etym>, <sense id="n36528.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stripe-bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">born to be flogged</hi> (ante-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 20</bibl> Ritschl.</sense></entryFree>
plagio: <entryFree id="n36529" type="main" key="pla^gi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plăgĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n36529.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to steal</hi> (a person), <hi rend="ital">kidnap</hi> (late Lat.): Moyses dicit, quicumque plagiaverit quemquam in Israel, etc., Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 14, 1, 1.</sense></entryFree>
plagiosippus: <entryFree id="n36530" type="main" key="Pla_gi^o^sippus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Plāgĭŏsippus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Plāgĭoxippus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. plaga <foreign lang="greek">-i(/ppos</foreign></etym>, a fictitious name, <sense id="n36530.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Beater</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Bruiser</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
plagipatida: <entryFree id="n36531" type="main" key="pla_gi^pa^ti^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plāgĭpătĭda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. plaga-patior</etym>, <sense id="n36531.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a buffet-bearer</hi> (ante-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plagipatidae, ferritribaces viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
plagium: <entryFree id="n36532" type="main" key="pla^gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plăgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n36532.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">man-stealing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kidnapping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the selling of freemen as slaves</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:15:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 15, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:15:1" default="NO">48, 15, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plago: <entryFree id="n36533" type="main" key="pla_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plāgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. plaga</etym>, <sense id="n36533.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wound</hi> (eccl. Lat.): aliquem, Aug. Civ. Dei, 21, 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,046:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Zach. 13, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:Schol. 6:655" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> Schol. 6, 655</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:133" default="NO">13, 133</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plagosus: <entryFree id="n36534" type="main" key="pla_go_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plāgōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36534.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of blows.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36534.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fond of flogging</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Orbilius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 70</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36534.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full</hi> <cb n="PLAN" /> <hi rend="ital">of blows</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wounds</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">dorsum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 222, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8</bibl></cit>, p. 203, 17.</sense></entryFree>
plagula: <entryFree id="n36535" type="main" key="pla^gu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plăgŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>3. plaga, C.</etym>. <sense id="n36535.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bed-curtain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a curtain</hi> (class., but not in Cic. or Cæs.): deme plagulam de lecto, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 378, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 86:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. 86, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ii primum vestem stragulam pretiosam, plagulas et alia textilia Romam advexerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36535.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A part of a garment which is to be sewed to the other parts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a breadth</hi> (ante-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=79" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 79</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n36535.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A sheet</hi> of paper (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 23, § 77</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plagusia: <entryFree id="n36536" type="main" key="pla^gu_si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plăgūsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n36536.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of fish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plagusias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
plana: <entryFree id="n36537" type="main" key="pla_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>plano</etym>, <sense id="n36537.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plane</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 200</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
planaratum: <entryFree id="n36538" type="main" key="pla_na^ra_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plānărātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. plaumoratum.</entryFree>
planaria: <entryFree id="n36539" type="main" key="Pla_na_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Plānārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n36539.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island in the Tyrrhenian Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Elba</hi>, another name for Planasia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 6, 12, § 80</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
planaris: <entryFree id="n36540" type="main" key="pla_na_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plānāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>planus</etym>, <sense id="n36540.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">on a level surface</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plane</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 708</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
planarius: <entryFree id="n36541" type="main" key="pla_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plānārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36541.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">on level ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">level</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">conflictus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interpellatio,</quote> <trans><tr>which took place before the judge ascended the tribunal</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 3, 11, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
planasia: <entryFree id="n36542" type="main" key="Planasi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Planasĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*planasi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n36542.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island in the Tyrrhenian Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">south of Ilva</hi> (<hi rend="ital">Elba</hi>), now <hi rend="ital">Pianosa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 6, 12, § 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 644</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
planca: <entryFree id="n36543" type="main" key="planca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">planca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root <foreign lang="greek">plak-</foreign>; v. 2. plaga</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">pla/c</foreign>, <sense id="n36543.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a board</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slab</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plank</hi> (post-Aug.): plancae tabulae planae, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=231" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 231</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">roboreae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 21, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36543.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A slab of marble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slab</hi> upon graves, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Don.</author> 278, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 1427, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plancianus: <entryFree id="n36544" type="gloss" key="Planci^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Plancĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. Plancus, II.</entryFree>
plancina: <entryFree id="n36545" type="main" key="Planci_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Plancīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n36545.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wife of Cn. Calpurnius Piso</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">75</bibl>; 6, 26.</sense></entryFree>
plancius: <entryFree id="n36546" type="main" key="Planci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Plancĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. Thus, Cn. Plancius, <hi rend="ital">a friend of Cicero</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and defended by him against a charge of bribery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in an oration still extant;</hi> cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Red. in Sen. 14, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 12, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
planctus: <entryFree id="n36547" type="main" key="planctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">planctus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>plango</etym>. <sense id="n36547.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a striking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beating</hi> accompanied by a loud noise, <hi rend="ital">a banging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rustling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roaring</hi> (postAug. and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): unum omnes incessere planctibus, of the <hi rend="ital">flappings</hi> of the Harpies' wings, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:494" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 494</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tremuit perterritus aether Planctibus insolitis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 136</bibl></cit>: planctus illisae cautibus undae, of the <hi rend="ital">roaring</hi> of the waves, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:690" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 690</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36547.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a beating of the breast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and face</hi> in mourning; <hi rend="ital">a wailing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lamentation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lament</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">plangor, lamentum, ploratus): clamor barbaro ululatu planctuque permixtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:12:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lamentis et planctibus tota regia personabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:5:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 6:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:6:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 6, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 92" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora illiso sonent Contusa planctu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 1045" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Thyest. 1045</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verberabam aegrum planctibus pectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemitus ac planctus,</quote> <trans><tr>groans and lamentations</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et factus est planctus magnus in Israel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 1, 26</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
plancus: <entryFree id="n36548" type="greek" key="plancus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plancus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pla/gkos</foreign>, <sense id="n36548.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of eagle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 3, 3, § 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36549" type="main" key="Plancus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Plancus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (flat-footed), <sense id="n36549.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>: plancae tabulae planae, ob quam causam et planci appellantur qui supra modum pedibus plani sunt, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=231" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 231</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">vola homini tantum, exceptis quibusdam: namque et hinc cognomina inventa Planci, Plauti, Scauri, Pansae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 45, 105, § 254</bibl></cit>: plancus, <foreign lang="greek">platu/pous</foreign>, Gloss. Cyrill.: <foreign lang="greek">stegano/podes</foreign>, planci, Gloss. Gr. Lat. So, Munatius Plancus, v. Munatius.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36549.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Plancĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Plancian</hi>: Diana, <hi rend="ital">who had a shrine in the house of the Planci</hi>, Viscont. Mus. Pio Clem. 2, p. 21 Mediol.</sense></entryFree>
plane: <entryFree id="n36550" type="main" key="pla_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plānē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. planus <sense id="n36550.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
planeta: <entryFree id="n36551" type="greek" key="pla^ne_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plănēta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-tes</orth>, is), or <orth extent="full" lang="la">plănēs</orth>, <itype>ētis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">planh/ths, pla/nhs</foreign>, <sense id="n36551.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wandering star</hi>, <hi rend="ital">planet</hi> (late Lat. for the class. stellae errantes, erraticae, errones).—Only <number>plur.</number> form planetae, Firm. Math. 2, 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 3, 284</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 3, 70, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">19, 24, 18</bibl>; Aus. Eclog. de Nomin. Sept. Dier.: Inscr. <pb n="1384" /> <cb n="PLAN" /> Fabr. p. 709, n. 307.—Form planetes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
planetarius: <entryFree id="n36552" type="main" key="pla^ne_ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plănētārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>planeta</etym>, <sense id="n36552.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an astrologer</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">illos planetarios, quos mathematicos vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 4:3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 4, 3</bibl></cit> (al. planos).</sense></entryFree>
planetes: <entryFree id="n36553" type="main" key="pla^ne_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plănētes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. planeta <sense id="n36553.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
planeticus: <entryFree id="n36554" type="greek" key="pla^ne_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plănētĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">planhtiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wandering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wandering about</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">sidera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
plangimonium: <entryFree id="n36555" type="main" key="plangi^mo_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plangĭmōnĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>plango</etym>, <sense id="n36555.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lamentation</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Vict. Turon. Poenit. 10.</sense></entryFree>
plango: <entryFree id="n36556" type="main" key="plango"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plango</orth>, <itype>nxi, nctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>from the root <foreign lang="greek">*p*l*a*g, plh/ssw</foreign>; cf. Lat. plāga</etym>, <sense id="n36556.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beat</hi>, esp. with a noise. </sense><sense id="n36556.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">plaudo): fluctus plangentes saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1155</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:115" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 115</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">moribundo vertice terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:334" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 16, 334</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto planguntur litora fluctu!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:19:121" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 19, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tympana palmis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc (Boreas) ipsas alis planget stridentibus Alpes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:588" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 588</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, of a bird when caught: <cit><quote lang="la">plangitur,</quote> <trans><tr>beats with its wings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 75</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36556.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to beat the breast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">head</hi>, etc., as a sign of grief (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui multis inspectantibus caput feriebas, femina plangebas, Cic. aer. alien. Mil. Fragm. 2, 4 (t. 11, p. 32 B. and K.): laniataque pectora plangens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 248</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">femur maerenti dextrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacertos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:636" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 636</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 111</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> (= <foreign lang="greek">ko/ptesqai</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">scissaeque capillos Planguntur matres Calydonides Eveninae,</quote> <trans><tr>beat themselves for agony</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:526" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 526</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36556.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to lament aloud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wring the hands;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">aliquem</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bewail</hi> a person or thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">planxere sorores Naïdes ... Planxere et Dryades: plangentibus absonat Echo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:505" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 505</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab omni plangitur arce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:417" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 417</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plangentia agmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plangentium gemitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 19, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo Sporum hortabatur ut lamentari ac plangere inciperet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plangentis populi derisor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:534" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 534</bibl></cit>.—With an <hi rend="ital">object</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tendit palmas, ceu sit planctura relictam Andromedam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> Germ. Arat. 198</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:297" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 297</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Memphiten bovem (i. e. Apim),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:27" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8, 27</bibl></cit> (7, 28): <cit><quote lang="la">damna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:117" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 159</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 11, 37</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutes quas neque lugeri neque plangi fas est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majore tumultu Planguntur nummi quam funera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:131" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 131</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
plangor: <entryFree id="n36557" type="main" key="plangor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plangor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>plango</etym>, <sense id="n36557.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a striking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beating</hi>, attended with noise. </sense><sense id="n36557.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">(undae) leni resonant plangore cachinni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 272</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feminis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:498" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 498</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36557.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a beating the breast</hi> or <hi rend="ital">face</hi> in token of grief; <hi rend="ital">loud mourning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wailing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lamentation</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">plangore et lamentatione complere forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:38:131" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 38, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feminei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:487" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 487</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare plangorem,</quote> <trans><tr>to make</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:421" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 421</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">percutit claro plangore lacertos, id. ib 4, 138: caesis plangore lacertis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:532" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 532</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
planguncula: <entryFree id="n36558" type="main" key="planguncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">planguncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl>, = <foreign lang="greek">plaggw/n</foreign>, <sense id="n36558.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little wax doll</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inventae sunt quinque plangunculae matronarum (al. lagunculae or imagunculae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 25</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
planiloquus: <entryFree id="n36559" type="main" key="pla_ni^lo^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plānĭlŏquus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>plane-loquor</etym>, <sense id="n36559.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">speaking clearly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">intelligibly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speaking plainly</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">di immortales, ut planiloqua est!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 4, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
planipes: <entryFree id="n36560" type="main" key="pla_ni^pes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plānĭpes</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>planus-pes, flatfoot, barefoot</etym>, <sense id="n36560.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of pantomime</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ballet-dancer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who performed without the comic</hi> soccus or <hi rend="ital">the tragic</hi> cothurnus: exsultat planipes, Atta ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 487</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">planipedes audit Fabios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:191" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">planipes saltans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:11:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 11, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
planitas: <entryFree id="n36561" type="hapax" key="pla_ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plānĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>planus</etym>, <sense id="n36561.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">plainness;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">distinctness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perspicuity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (al. plenitas, sanitas, gravitas).</sense></entryFree>
planities: <entryFree id="n36562" type="main" key="pla_ni^ti^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plānĭtĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">plānĭtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, very rare; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 43</bibl>), and <number>plur.</number> <itype>planitiae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36562.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flat</hi> or <hi rend="ital">even surface</hi>, <hi rend="ital">level ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a plain</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aequata agri planities,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:48:section=107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 48, § 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat inter oppidum et collem planitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">planities erat inter sinistros montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 59:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 59, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 48 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">speculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:294" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 294</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter planitiem regionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1</bibl></cit> 1: pars planitiae,<cb n="PLAN" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">CLIVOM MARTIS IN PLANICIEM REDEGERVNT S. P. Q. R.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 152, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">a similar inscription with the form PLANITIAM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 152, 7</bibl></cit>: nulla planitia dividit, Auct. B. Hisp. 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">planitiae coronarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
planitudo: <entryFree id="n36563" type="gloss" key="pla_ni^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plānĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>planus</etym>, <sense id="n36563.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">evenness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">levelness</hi>: planitudo, <foreign lang="greek">o(mali/a</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
plano: <entryFree id="n36564" type="main" key="pla_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plāno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36564.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to level</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make plain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">even</hi>, etc. (post-class.): planate vias, Coripp. Laud. Justin. 2, 223.</sense></entryFree>
planta: <entryFree id="n36565" type="main" key="planta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">planta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>for plancta; cf. plānus; root v. plango</etym>. <sense id="n36565.0" n="I" level="1"> Any vegetable production that serves to propagate the species, <hi rend="ital">a sprout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shoot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twig</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sprig</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sucker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">graft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cutting</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:55" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">malleoli, plantae, sarmenta, viviradices, propagines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36565.1" n="B" level="2"> A young tree, a shrub that may be transplanted, <hi rend="ital">a set</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slip</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 193</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plantas ex seminario transferre in aliud,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 11, 14, § 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plantae sinapis primā hieme translatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:29" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">thymi novellas plantas disponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11</bibl></cit>. 3, 40: <cit><quote lang="la">puteusque brevis ... in tenuis plantas facile diffunditur haustu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:227" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">planta, quam quis in solo nostro posuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:74" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 74</bibl></cit> (but not used in the general sense of <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, for which, in class. Lat.: <cit><quote lang="la">res quae gignitur e terrā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 5, 13</bibl></cit>; v. Madv. ad loc., and Krebs, Antibarb. p. 890).—</sense><sense id="n36565.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sole of the foot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ah! tibi ne teneras glacies secet aspera plantas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:591" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 591</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubitales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedum plantae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 458</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi summa licet contingere sidera plantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:8:43" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 8, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plantā duci,</quote> <trans><tr>to be dragged by the heel</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:125" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tremulis insistere plantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assequi plantā,</quote> <trans><tr>in the course</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:246" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamina plantae,</quote> <trans><tr>a race</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:458" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 458</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrupedem planta fodiens, i. e. calcaribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:212" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsurgere in plantas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 111:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 111, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid enim velocis gloria plantae Praestat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:98" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plantā magnā calcor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:247" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 247</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">sutorem supra plantam ascendere vetuit (like ultra crepidam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:12" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
plantago: <entryFree id="n36566" type="main" key="planta_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plantāgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n36566.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plantain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 39, § 80</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plantaris: <entryFree id="n36567" type="main" key="planta_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plantāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>planta</etym>. <sense id="n36567.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to sets; subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">plantārĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">sets</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slips</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">young trees</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plantaria transferuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 10, 34, § 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non Epicurum Suspicit exigui laetum plantaribus horti,</quote> <trans><tr>trees</tr>, <tr>plants</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:123" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 123</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36567.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the hair</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:39" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 39</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36567.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the sole of the foot</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>); <cit><quote lang="la">of Mercury: summa pedum propere plantaribus alligat alis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:304" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 304</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">plantārĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <hi rend="ital">winged shoes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sandals</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aërii plantaria vellet Perseos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:67" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 67</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
plantarium: <entryFree id="n36568" type="main" key="planta_ri^um1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plantārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nurserygarden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nursery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plantaria instituunt anniculasque transferunt, et iterum bimas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 8, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 20, 34, § 149</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36569" type="main" key="planta_ri^um2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plantārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36569.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the sole of the foot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tamen de plantario ferri orietur (statua),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 2, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
plantatio: <entryFree id="n36570" type="main" key="planta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plantātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>planto</etym>. <sense id="n36570.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A setting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">planting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transplanting</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 4, 10, § 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36570.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant set out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">transplanted</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:17:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 17, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:15:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 15, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plantator: <entryFree id="n36571" type="main" key="planta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plantātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36571.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a setter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">planter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transplanter</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 89" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:112" default="NO">112</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plantiger: <entryFree id="n36572" type="main" key="planti^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plantĭger</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>plantagero</etym>, <sense id="n36572.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having shoots</hi>, <hi rend="ital">branching</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">siliqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 8, 16, § 59</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
planto: <entryFree id="n36573" type="main" key="planto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">planto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>planta</etym>. <sense id="n36573.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To set</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transplant</hi> (cf. sero): <cit><quote lang="la">hoc modo plantantur punicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 10, 13, § 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 4, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 20, 9</bibl></cit> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n36573.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To fix in place</hi>, and hence, <hi rend="ital">to form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui plantavit aurem, non audiet?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:93:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 93, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
planula: <entryFree id="n36574" type="gloss" key="pla_nu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plānŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>1. planus</etym>, <sense id="n36574.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little plane</hi>: planula, <foreign lang="greek">e)gkopi/s</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
planum: <entryFree id="n36575" type="main" key="pla_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plānum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. planus, I. B.</entryFree>
planus: <entryFree id="n36576" type="main" key="pla_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>for placnus; root plac-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">plakou=s</foreign>; cf. 2. plaga, planca</etym>, <sense id="n36576.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">even</hi>, <hi rend="ital">level</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plane</hi> (class.; cf. aequor). </sense><sense id="n36576.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilis et plana via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: cum duae formae praestantes sint, ex solidis globus, ex planis<cb n="PLAN" />  circulus aut orbis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:18:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N.
