D. 2, 18, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">planum et aequabile corpus universitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">planus et aequus locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:17:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 17, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces,</quote> <trans><tr>flat-fish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 20, 37, § 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificia, quae plano pede instituuntur,</quote> <trans><tr>on level ground</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam jacuit planum mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:62" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">planā faciem contundere palmā,</quote> <trans><tr>flat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:128" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 128</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aditus planior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 29</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">planissimus locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 96</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n36576.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">plānum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">level ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a plain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem in planum deducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 49:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 49, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per planum ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadere in plano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:4:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in planum deferre aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 10:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra in plano erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:59" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de plano,</quote> <trans><tr>on level ground</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:6:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 6, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Grat. Act. 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad planiora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 1, 34</bibl></cit>.—In partic., jurid. t. t.: e plano or de plano, <hi rend="ital">on level ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">below</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not on the bench</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">out of court</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extrajudicially</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut e plano aut e quaesitoris tribunali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">custodiae non solum pro tribunali, sed et de plano audiri possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:18:18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 18, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:1:3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 37, 1, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36576.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36576.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Lowly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconsiderable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">humble</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">haec magnanimitas melius in tribunali, quam in plano conspicitur,</quote> <trans><tr>shows better in one of high than of low station</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:5:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunam suam in planum deferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 10:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tranq. 10, 6</bibl></cit>: de plano, <hi rend="ital">without difficulty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">easily</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">hoc tibi de plano possum promittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:411" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 411</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36576.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Plain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intelligible</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">satin' haec sunt tibi plana et certa!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">narrationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:26:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 26, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjectatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 7, 5, § 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pol planum id quidem est,</quote> <trans><tr>it is plain</tr>, <tr>clear</tr>, <tr>evident</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 32</bibl></cit>: planum facere, <hi rend="ital">to make plain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">intelligible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to set forth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:18:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 18, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 10, § 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 20, § 52</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 5, 64, § 165: planum facere multis testibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">planum facere atque probare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:932" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 932</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36576.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Easy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">free from danger</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illam viam vitae, quam ante praecipitem et lubricam esse ducebat, huic planae et stabili praeponendam esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,017:42:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Flac. 42, 105</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">plānē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">plainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evenly;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">simply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinctly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intelligibly.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36576.7" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">videre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 4, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plane loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plane et dilucide loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plane et perspicue expedire aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:5:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plane et Latine loqui,</quote> <trans><tr>to speak plainly</tr>, <tr>right out</tr>, <tr>without circumlocution</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 6, 17</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo pacto excludi potis est planius, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">planius dicere (opp. dicere obscurius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:80:329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 80, 329</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">planius atque apertius dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:14:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 14, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid, hoc planius egissem, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:10:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 10, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 28, 68, § 273</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apertissime planissimeque explicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:64:section=156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 64, § 156</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36576.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">wholly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entirely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">completely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quite</hi> (class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdidisti mulierem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illam plane amo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carere sensu communi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod reliquos coheredes convenisti, plane bene,</quote> <trans><tr>you have acted quite right</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud plane moleste tuli, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non plane par,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 20, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex rebus penitus perspectis, planeque cognitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:23:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 23, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propemodum, vel plane potius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:97:332" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 97, 332</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">explicari mihi tuum consilium plane volo, ut penitus intellegam,</quote> <trans><tr>thoroughly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">planissime perii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plane perfecteque eruditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:81:282" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 81, 282</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plane atque omnino rem defuisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 59, 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plane cum,</quote> <trans><tr>particularly as</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 208</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et plane quid rectum esset diutius cogitare malui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 12, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n36576.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">By all means</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assuredly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo acrius te rogo ut plane ad nos advoles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 24, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n36576.10" n="3" level="3"> In partic., in affirmative answers, <hi rend="ital">certainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be sure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exactly so</hi> (anteclass.): ego et domi privatus sum et perii. <hi rend="ital">Ge.</hi> Plane istuc est, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 73</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">De.</hi> Etiam argentum est ultro objectum, ut sit, qui vivat, dum aliud aliquid flagitii conficiat <hi rend="ital">Ge.</hi> Planissume, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 2, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36576.11" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Besides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:52" default="NO">32, 1, 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36577" type="greek" key="pla^nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plănus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pla/nos</foreign>, <sense id="n36577.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a juggler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impostor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheat</hi> (class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">erro): ille planus improbissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:26:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 26, 72</bibl></cit>: fracto <pb n="1385" /> <cb n="PLAT" /> crure planum attollere, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 82</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plasma: <entryFree id="n36578" type="greek" key="plasma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plasma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pla/sma</foreign>, something formed or moulded. <sense id="n36578.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an image</hi>, <hi rend="ital">figure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a creature</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">emancipator servientis plasmatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 7, 184</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36578.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an affected modulation of the voice</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:17" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sit lectio non in canticum dissoluta, nec plasmate, ut nunc a plerisque fit, effeminata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36578.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a fiction</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9</bibl>, §§ 913, 998.</sense></entryFree>
plasmatio: <entryFree id="n36579" type="main" key="plasma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plasmātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>plasmo</etym>, <sense id="n36579.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a forming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fashioning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">creating</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 22</bibl>, n. 38; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Par. 1, 4, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plasmator: <entryFree id="n36580" type="main" key="plasma_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plasmātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a former</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fashioner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">creator</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">deus hominis plasmator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
plasmo: <entryFree id="n36581" type="main" key="plasmo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plasmo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>plasma</etym>, <sense id="n36581.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mould</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fashion</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">corporis effigiem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 933</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo plasmatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 13 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:118:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 118, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 73, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
plasso: <entryFree id="n36582" type="greek" key="plasso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plasso</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">pla/ssw</foreign> = plasmo, <sense id="n36582.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mould</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shape</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:2:1" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 2, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plastes: <entryFree id="n36583" type="greek" key="plastes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plastes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pla/sths</foreign>, <sense id="n36583.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a moulder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">potter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">modeller</hi>, <hi rend="ital">statuary</hi> (post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. fictor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:17:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudatissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 45, § 154</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:41:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 41, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36583.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A creator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maker</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Israel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:45:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 45, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 45, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
plastica: <entryFree id="n36584" type="main" key="plasti^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plastĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. plastice.</entryFree>
plasticator: <entryFree id="n36585" type="main" key="plasti^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plastĭcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>plasticus</etym>, <sense id="n36585.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a moulder</hi> or <hi rend="ital">modeller in clay</hi> (post-class.), Firm. Math. 8, 16.</sense></entryFree>
plastice: <entryFree id="n36586" type="greek" key="plasti^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plastĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">plastikh/</foreign>, <sense id="n36586.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plastic art</hi>, <hi rend="ital">statuary</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui plasticen matrem statuariae scalpturaeque et caelaturae esse dixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 43, § 151</bibl></cit>.—Form plastica, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cult. Fem. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> 5; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Spect. 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plasticus: <entryFree id="n36587" type="greek" key="plasti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plastĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">plastiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36587.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to moulding</hi> or <hi rend="ital">modelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plastic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <trans><tr>plastic</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 1, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36587.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pla-stĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a moulder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">modeller</hi>, <hi rend="ital">statuary</hi> (post-class.), Firm. Math. 7, 25.</sense></entryFree>
plastus: <entryFree id="n36588" type="greek" key="plastus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plastus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">plasto/s</foreign> (formed); trop., <sense id="n36588.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fictitious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceptive</hi> (postclass.), Fulg. Myth. praef. 1.</sense></entryFree>
plataeae: <entryFree id="n36589" type="main" key="Pla^taeae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Plătaeae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*platai=ai</foreign>, <sense id="n36589.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Platœa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a city in Bœotia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated for a victory of the Greeks over the Persians</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kokla</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:18:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 18, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Arist. 2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Arist. 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Paus. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:12:11 al" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 12, 11 al.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36589.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Plătaeenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Platœa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Platœans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:9:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 9, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36589.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Plătaeēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Platœa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Platœan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
platalea: <entryFree id="n36590" type="main" key="pla^ta^le^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plătălĕa</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">plătĕa</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 40, 56, § 115</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n36590.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the spoonbill</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:49:124" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 49, 124</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
platanetum: <entryFree id="n36591" type="gloss" key="pla^ta^ne_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plătănētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>platanus</etym>, <sense id="n36591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a grove of plane-trees</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">platanw/n</foreign>, platanetum, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
plataninus: <entryFree id="n36592" type="greek" key="pla^ta^ni_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plătănīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">platanino/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36592.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the plane-tree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plane-</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:16:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 16, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
platanista: <entryFree id="n36593" type="greek" key="pla^ta^nista"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plătănista</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">platanisth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36593.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fish in the Ganges</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 15, 17, § 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
platanon: <entryFree id="n36594" type="greek" key="pla^ta^non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plătănon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">platanw/n</foreign>, <sense id="n36594.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a grove of plane-trees</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">postero die in eundem platanona descendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 131</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:19:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 19, 2</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 1</bibl>, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
platanus: <entryFree id="n36595" type="greek" key="pla^ta^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plătănus</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (<sense id="n36595.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. plur.</hi> platanūs, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 123</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pla/tanos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the platane</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Oriental plane-tree</hi>: sub platano umbriferā, Cic. poēt. Div. 2, 30, 63; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 7, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 1, 3, § 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">steriles platani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelebs (because it did not, like the elm, serve to support vines),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 15, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 11, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:12" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
platea: <entryFree id="n36596" type="greek" key="pla^te_a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plătēa</orth> (plătĕa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 15, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 71</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">platei=?a</foreign>. <sense id="n36596.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A broad way in a city</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a street</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quis hic est qui in plateam ingreditur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hac habitasse plateă dictum est Chrysidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">purae sunt plateae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 71</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n36596.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An open space in a house</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an area</hi>, <hi rend="ital">court-yard</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 24</bibl>. <cb n="PLAU" /></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36597" type="main" key="pla^te^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plătĕa</orth>, <sense id="n36597.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the spoonbill</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 40, 56, § 115</bibl>; v. platalea.</sense></entryFree>
platessa: <entryFree id="n36598" type="main" key="pla^tessa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plătessa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n36598.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flatfish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plaice</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 4, 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
platice: <entryFree id="n36599" type="main" key="pla^ti^ce_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plătĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. platicus <sense id="n36599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36600" type="greek" key="pla^ti^ce_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plătĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">platikh/</foreign>, <sense id="n36600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">general</hi> or <hi rend="ital">summary instruction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a general plan</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scheme</hi> (post-class.): nunc ad platicen revertamur, Firm. Math. 2, 16.</sense></entryFree>
platicus: <entryFree id="n36601" type="greek" key="pla^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plătĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">platiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36601.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">general</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compendious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summary</hi> (post-class.): dispositio, Firm. Math. 3, 2.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">plă-tĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in general</hi>, <hi rend="ital">generally</hi> (post-class.): platice institui, Firm. Math. 2, 16.</sense></entryFree>
plato: <entryFree id="n36602" type="main" key="Pla^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Plăto</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Plăton</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pla/twn</foreign>. <sense id="n36602.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated Grecian philosopher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the disciple of Socrates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the instructor of Aristotle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and founder of the Academic philosophy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:31:121" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 31, 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:17:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 17, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 3, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Plato divinus auctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:Or. 6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. Or. 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 6:6:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 6, 6, 13</bibl>.—In Greek <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">doctum Platona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 2, 5</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36602.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Plătōnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*platwniko/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Plato</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Platonic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sublimitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:2:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo, speaking of Cicero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 12:46" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 12, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ideae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 6:6:26" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 6, 6, 26</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Plă-tōnĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">followers of the Platonic philosophy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Platonists</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 1, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36602.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An obscure Epicurean of Sardis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemporary with Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:4:section=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 4, § 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
platyceros: <entryFree id="n36603" type="greek" key="pla^ty^ce^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plătycĕros</orth>, <itype>ōtis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">platu/kerws</foreign> (broad-horn), <sense id="n36603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having spreading horns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">broadhorned; acc. plur.</hi> platycerotas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 45, § 123</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
platycoriasis: <entryFree id="n36604" type="greek" key="pla^ty^co^ri^a^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plătycŏrĭăsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">platukori/asis</foreign>, <sense id="n36604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an excessive dilatation of the pupil of the eye</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
platyophthalmus: <entryFree id="n36605" type="greek" key="pla^ty^ophthalmus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plătyophthalmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">platuo/fqalmos</foreign> (eye-dilator), a name for <sense id="n36605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">antimony</hi>, because it was supposed to enlarge and beautify the eye, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 6, 34, § 102</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
platyphyllon: <entryFree id="n36606" type="greek" key="pla^ty^phyllon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plătyphyllon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">platu/fullon</foreign> (broad-leaf), <sense id="n36606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a broad-leaved species of the plant</hi> tithymalus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 44, § 70</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
platys: <entryFree id="n36607" type="greek" key="pla^tys"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plătys</orth>, <itype>yos</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">platu/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36607.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">broad</hi> (post-Aug.; found only in <hi rend="ital">nom. sing.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">nervus, qui platys appellatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 58, § 90</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
plaudo: <entryFree id="n36608" type="main" key="plaudo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plaudo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">plōdo</orth>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 478, 5</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:52" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 52</bibl>), <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n36608.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to clap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beat</hi> any thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">plango),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:866" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 866</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clipeum pectore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:134" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 3, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">choreas pedibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to execute a choral dance</tr>, <tr>stamping with the feet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:644" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 644</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plausis alis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:507" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 507</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 577</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36608.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to clap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beat</hi> (of two bodies striking together). </sense><sense id="n36608.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">alis Plaudentem figit sub nube columbam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 515</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pennis,</quote> <trans><tr>with her wings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 97</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aversas inter se manus collide, non plaudent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:28" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36608.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n36608.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To clap the hands in token of approbation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to applaud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clap</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">manus suas in plaudendo consumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic ita plausum est, ut salvā re publicā Pompeio plaudi solebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 19, 3</bibl></cit>.—In the theatre, at the close of the piece: nunc, spectatores, Jovis summi causā clare plaudite, Plaut. Am. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; id. Ep. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">usque Sessuri, donec cantor, vos plaudite, dicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 155</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ventum est ad ipsum illud. quo veteres tragoediae comoediaeque clauduntur, Plodite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:52" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 52</bibl></cit> Spald. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf. also: manibus clare, Plaut. Cas. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectavi ego pridem comicos ad istum modum Sapienter dicta dicere atque is plaudier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Rud. 4:7:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 7, 24</bibl></cit>: in aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to express disapprobation of any one by clapping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pounding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stamping</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to hiss him off</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> Octav. 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36608.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to express approbation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to approve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">applaud</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plaudit sepultis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dis hominibusque plaudentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:157" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 157</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">funus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:146" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 146</bibl></cit>: sibi, <hi rend="ital">to applaud one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be satisfied</hi> or <hi rend="ital">well contented with one's self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus me sibilat: at mihi plaudo Ipse domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ipse tibi plaudis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36608.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To strike hands</hi> in completing a bargain: <cit><quote lang="la">stultus homo plaudet manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:17:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 17, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
plaumoratum: <entryFree id="n36609" type="foreign" key="plaumo^ra_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plaumŏrātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (Rætian), <sense id="n36609.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> <cb n="PLAU" /> <hi rend="ital">kind of plough</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 18, 48, § 172</bibl>; v. Sillig ad h. 1.</sense></entryFree>
plausibilis: <entryFree id="n36610" type="main" key="plausi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plausĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>plaudo</etym>, <sense id="n36610.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deserving applause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">praiseworthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acceptable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasing</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">censorium nomen (with populare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 5:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">plau-sĭbĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with applause</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium plausibilius manifestare,</quote> <trans><tr>with more applause</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
plausilis: <entryFree id="n36611" type="main" key="plausi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plausĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36611.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that claps applause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">applauding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plausive</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">plausilibus ulnis (al. plausibilibus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">plausilis, plausibilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 172</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
plausio: <entryFree id="n36612" type="main" key="plausi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plausĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">applause</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Tripart. 2, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plausito: <entryFree id="n36613" type="main" key="plausi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plausĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n36613.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to clap</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): plausitat arborea clamans de fronde palumbes, i. e. <hi rend="ital">flaps its wings</hi>, Auct. Carm. Philom. 21.</sense></entryFree>
plausor: <entryFree id="n36614" type="main" key="plausor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plausor</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">plōsor</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Carm. 9, 300</bibl>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who claps applause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an applauder</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">in vacuo laetus sessor plausorque theatro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 130</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plaustra: <entryFree id="n36615" type="main" key="plaustra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plaustra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. plaustrum.</entryFree>
plaustrarius: <entryFree id="n36616" type="main" key="plaustra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plaustrārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">plostr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>plaustrum, plostrum</etym>, <sense id="n36616.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a wagon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wagon-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">asini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juga duo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36616.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">plau-strārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">plostr-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n36616.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A wagon - maker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wheelwright</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plaustrariorum vectigal,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36616.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A wagon - driver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wagoner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Aquiliae actione plaustrarium (al. plostrarium) teneri placet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:27" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
plaustrilucus: <entryFree id="n36617" type="main" key="plaustri^lu_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plaustrĭlūcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>plaustrum-luceo</etym>, <sense id="n36617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shining like Charles's Wain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brilliant</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 912</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plaustrix: <entryFree id="n36618" type="gloss" key="plaustrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plaustrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>plausor</etym>, <sense id="n36618.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female applauder</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 150, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plaustrum: <entryFree id="n36619" type="main" key="plaustrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plaustrum</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">plostrum</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:22:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 22, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 22</bibl>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">plaustra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n36619.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. plavas, ship; prop., that which sways hither and thither; root plu-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ple/w, plu/nw</foreign></etym>, a vehicle for carrying heavy loads, <hi rend="ital">a wagon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cart.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36619.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vendat plostrum vetus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in plaustrum conici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:27:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 27, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stridentia plaustra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:10:59" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 10, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 177</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut stridet plaustrum onustum foeno,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Amos, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Num. 7, 3</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">plaustrum perculi,</quote> <trans><tr>I have upset! I am done for!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 2, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36619.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the constellation Charles's Wain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Great Bear</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">flexerat obliquo plaustrum temone Bootes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:447" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 447</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:10:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 10, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 10, 2</bibl> (called plaustra Parrhasis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 5, 282 sq.</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
plausus: <entryFree id="n36620" type="main" key="plausus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plausus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from plaudo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36621" type="main" key="plausus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plausus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. 3. plausus <sense id="n36621.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36622" type="main" key="plausus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plausus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">plōsus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl>), ūs (a later collat. form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">plausus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, Cod. Th. 15, 9, 2), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>plaudo</etym>, <sense id="n36622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a clapping sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the noise that arises from the beating</hi> or <hi rend="ital">striking together of two bodies.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36622.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): it eques et plausu cava concutit ungula terram, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 419 Vahl.),—Of cocks: plausu premunt alas, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:26:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 26, 57</bibl> (Trag. v. 251 Vahl.).—Of doves: <cit><quote lang="la">plausumque exterrita pennis Dat tecto ingentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 21, 24, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 20, 22, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palma cum palmā collata plausum facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:28:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 28, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36622.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a clapping of hands in token of approbation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">applause</hi> (class. and very freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">si voletis plausum fabulae huic clarum dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 3, 65</bibl></cit>; cf. v. 67 and plaudo, II. B.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:58:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 58, 123</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a plebe plausu maximo est mihi gratulatio significata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantis plausibus, tantā approbatione infimorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a cuncto consessu plausum multiplex datus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:18:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 18, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui plausus impertire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plausus quaerere in aliquā re,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">captare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:26:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 26, 64</bibl></cit>: petere. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:77" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 77</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plautianus: <entryFree id="n36623" type="main" key="Plauti^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Plautĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Plautius, B.</entryFree>
plautinus: <entryFree id="n36624" type="main" key="Plauti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Plautīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. Plautus, II.</entryFree>
plautius: <entryFree id="n36625" type="main" key="Plauti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Plautĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Plōt-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36625.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n36625.1" n="1" level="3"> M. Plautius Hypsaeus, <pb n="1386" /> <cb n="PLEB" /> <hi rend="ital">a consul</hi> A. U. C. 630, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:36:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 36, 166</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n36625.2" n="2" level="3"> M. Plautius Silvanus, <hi rend="ital">a tribune of the people</hi> A. U. C. 666, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:Cic. Corn. p. 79" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> Cic. Corn. p. 79</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36625.3" n="3" level="3"> L. Plotius Gallus, <hi rend="ital">a rhetorician in the time of Marius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36625.4" n="4" level="3"> L. Plotius, <hi rend="ital">a poet who celebrated the Mithridatic war</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 9, 20</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36625.5" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Plautĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Plōt-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a Plautius</hi> (<hi rend="ital">Plotius</hi>), <hi rend="ital">Plautian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Plotian</hi>: Plautia lex, <hi rend="ital">of the tribune of the people</hi> M. Plautius Sylvanus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:Cic. Corn. p. 79" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> Cic. Corn. p. 79</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse (Catilina) lege Plautiā interrogatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 31, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 13, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Plautia rogatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:3:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Plotia rogatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36625.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Plautĭānus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Plōt-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Plautian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabulae,</quote> <trans><tr>of the comic poet Plautius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de bonis Plotianis,</quote> <trans><tr>belonging to a certain Plotius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
plautus: <entryFree id="n36626" type="main" key="plautus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plautus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">plōt-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n36626.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Flat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">broad</hi>: plauti appellantur canes, quorum aures languidae sunt ac flaccidae et latius videntur patere, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=231" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 231</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">conchae plautiores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n36626.1" n="II" level="1"> Among the Umbrians, <hi rend="ital">flat-footed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(plotos appellant) Umbri pedibus planis (natos . . . unde et Maccius) poëta, quia Umber Sarsinas erat, a pedum planitie initio Plotus, postea Plautus coeptus est dici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=238" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 238</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=239" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 239</bibl> ib.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36627" type="main" key="Plautus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Plautus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>flat-foot, v. 1. plautus</etym>, <sense id="n36627.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Umbrian surname.</hi>—So, T. Maccius (or Maccus) Plautus, <hi rend="ital">a celebrated Roman comic poet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a native of the Umbrian village Sarsina.</hi>—(On the name Maccius, instead of the earlier reading Accius or Attius, v. Ritschl, De Plauti poëtae nominibus, in his Parergon Plautinorum I. pp. 3-43; <cit><quote lang="la">and respecting his life and writings,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> pp. 47 - 579), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:15:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 15, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:99" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 99</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36627.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the works of Plautus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a comedy of Plautus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adporto vobis Plautum linguā non manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. prol. 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36627.2" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Plautīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Plautus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Plautian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a father in a play of Plautus</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ep. ad Brut. 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numeri et sales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 270</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:99" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: prosapia, i. e. <hi rend="ital">poor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mean</hi>, because Plautus was said to have worked in a mill, <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> Octav. 14</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus Plautinissimi,</quote> <trans><tr>most Plautus-like</tr>, <tr>altogether in Plautus's manner</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
plebecula: <entryFree id="n36628" type="main" key="ple_be_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plēbēcŭla</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">plēbĭcŭla</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 2:36" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 2, 36</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>plebs</etym>, <sense id="n36628.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the common people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the populace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the mob</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rabble</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">misera ac jejuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 186</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:6" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plebeius: <entryFree id="n36629" type="main" key="ple_be_i^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plēbēĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ējus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n36629.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the common people</hi> or <hi rend="ital">commonalty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plebeian</hi> (opp. to patricius), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">familia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 23</bibl>: Pudicitia, <hi rend="ital">the goddess of Chastity of the plebeians</hi>, as there was also a Pudicitia patricia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=237" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 237</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">ludi,</quote> <trans><tr>popular sports</tr>, <tr>shows instituted by the commonalty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatum (opp. divitibus responsa data),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:588" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 588</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deciorum animae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:254" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 254</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">plēbēĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a plebeian</hi>, Enn. ap. Fest. s. v. mutire, p. 145 Müll. (Trag. v. 376 Vahl.); <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 4, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36629.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in a contemptuous sense, <hi rend="ital">plebeian</hi> (opp. to refined, elevated), <hi rend="ital">common</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vulgar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">low</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam nos videmur tibi plebei et pauperes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: licet concurrant omnes plebei philosophi; <cit><quote lang="la">sic enim ii, qui a Platone, et Socrate, et ab eā familiā dissident, appellandi videntur, i. e. the Epicureans),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:23:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 23, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpura plebeia ac paene fusca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">charta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:22:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 22, 23</bibl></cit>,—75: <cit><quote lang="la">gemma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 9, 45, § 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 21, 3</bibl></cit>.—Adverb., <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 93</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plebes: <entryFree id="n36630" type="main" key="ple_bes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plēbes</orth>, <itype>is and ĕi</itype>, v. plebs.</entryFree>
plebicola: <entryFree id="n36631" type="main" key="ple_bi^co^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plēbĭcŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>plebs-colo</etym>, <sense id="n36631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who courts the favor of the common people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a friend of the people</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ab hoc plebicolā tribuno plebis eicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:31:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 31, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:52:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 52, 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plebis: <entryFree id="n36632" type="main" key="ple_bis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plēbis</orth>, v. plebs.</entryFree>
plebiscitum: <entryFree id="n36633" type="main" key="ple_bisci_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plēbiscītum</orth> (also separately <orth extent="full" lang="la">plēbi scītum</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 58</bibl>), i. <gen>n.</gen> (<case>abl.</case> plebis scitu, Decret. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 2, 3</bibl>) [plebs-scitum], <sense id="n36633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a decree</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ordinance of the people</hi> (opp.: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus consultum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:17:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 17, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 2, 4</bibl>: plebis scitum igitur est secundum eum Capitonem lex quam <cb n="PLEC" /> plebes, non populus, accipit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:20:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 20, 6</bibl>; cf. plebs, I., and scitum, s. v. <itype>scisco</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></sense></entryFree>
plebitas: <entryFree id="n36634" type="main" key="ple_bi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plēbĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>plebs</etym>, <sense id="n36634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the rank of a common citizen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plebeian rank</hi> or <hi rend="ital">condition</hi> (ante-class.): propter tenuitatem, et plebitatem, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 149, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hemina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 149, 5</bibl></cit> (plebitatem, ignobilitatem, Non.).</sense></entryFree>
plebs: <entryFree id="n36635" type="main" key="plebs"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plebs</orth> (in inscriptions often PLEPS), -bis, and archaic <orth extent="full" lang="la">plēbēs</orth> (‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">plēbis</orth>), <itype>is and ĕi</itype> (plebium, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 709: <sense id="n36635.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">plebibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 166" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 166</bibl></cit>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root ple-, fill; whence Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pi/mplhmi, plh/rhs</foreign>; cf. <foreign lang="greek">plh= qos</foreign>, multitude</etym>. </sense><sense id="n36635.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the common people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the commons</hi> or <hi rend="ital">commonalty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the plebeians</hi> (opp. the patricians, senators, and knights; <cit><quote lang="la">whereas populus signifies the collective people, including, therefore, the Senate),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: plebes in hoc regi antistat loco, licet Lacrumare plebi, regi honeste non licet, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Epit. Nep. p. 590</bibl> Mign. (Trag. v. 271 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">plebs a populo eo differt quo species a genere: nam appellatione populi universi cives significantur, connumeratis etiam patriciis et senatoribus: plebis autem appellatione sine patribus et senatu ceteri cives significantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebes dominandi studio permota a patribus secessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 33, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita tribuni plebei creati duo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 33, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum decem tribunos plebi faceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:65:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 65, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non enim populi, sed plebis eum (sc.: tribunum plebis) magistratum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populo plebique Romanae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in duas partes ego civitatem divisam arbitror in patres, et plebem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Or. ad Caes. 2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Or. ad Caes. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Martia Roma triplex equitatu, plebe, senatu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 11, 78</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n36635.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen. </sense><sense id="n36635.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The great mass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the multitude</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Hyrcaniā, plebs publicos alit canes, optimates domesticos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:45:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 45, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebem et infimam multitudinem delinire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:35:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 35, 95</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36635.4" n="B" level="2"> With accessory notion of contempt, <hi rend="ital">the populace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the lower class</hi> or <hi rend="ital">order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the mass</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">multitudo de plebe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quadringentis sex septem millia desunt, Plebs eris,</quote> <trans><tr>you shall be plebeian</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">misera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventosa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immensa nimiaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:194" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 194</bibl></cit>.—Among the gods: <cit><quote lang="la">plebs Superūm, Fauni, Satyrique, Laresque, Fluminaque, et Nymphae, Semideūmque genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:81" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 81</bibl></cit>.—Of bees, <hi rend="ital">a stock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swarm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hive</hi> (meaning the great mass, opp. to the queen); in <number>plur.</number> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">tres alveorum plebes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:11:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: corona plebium, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 709.—</sense><sense id="n36635.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The whole people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">community</hi>, = populus (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:23:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 23, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebs tua Israel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 2, 32</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
plecta: <entryFree id="n36636" type="main" key="plecta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plecta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. plecto</etym>, archit. t. t., <sense id="n36636.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a border</hi> of interwoven lines in relief, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 7, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plectibilis: <entryFree id="n36637" type="main" key="plecti^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plectĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. plecto</etym>. <sense id="n36637.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deserving punishment</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">invidia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 6</bibl></cit>: usurpatio, Cod. Th. 14, 3, 16.—</sense><sense id="n36637.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">penal</hi>: severitas, Cod. Th. 12, 1, 161.</sense></entryFree>
plectilis: <entryFree id="n36638" type="main" key="plecti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plectĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. plecto</etym>, <sense id="n36638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">plaited.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36638.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">corona plectilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36638.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">complicated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">involved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intricate</hi> (post-class.): syllogismi, Prud. Apoth. praef. 2, 36.</sense></entryFree>
plecto: <entryFree id="n36639" type="main" key="ple^cto1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plĕcto</orth>, <itype>xi and xŭi, xum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root plek-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ple/kw, plokh/</foreign>; Lat. plicin sim-plic-is, im-plic-o, etc.; cf. 3. plaga</etym>. <sense id="n36639.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To plait</hi>, <hi rend="ital">braid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interweave</hi> (rare; mostly in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; not in Cic. or Cæs.; syn.: plico, flecto, necto]. </sense><sense id="n36639.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">crines plexueris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 16, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coronam de spinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:27:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 27, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plexa colligata significat ex Graeco, cui nos etiam praepositionem adicimus, cum dicimus perplexa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=230" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 230</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">plexae coronae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1399" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1399</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flores plexi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 284</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colligationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36639.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ple-xus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">involved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intricate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entangled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ambiguous</hi> (ante-class.): plexa, non falsa autumare dictio Delphis solet, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 237, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36639.3" n="M" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To twist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">monstrabat vitulus quo se pacto plecteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 9, 3</bibl></cit> dub. (al. flecteret).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36640" type="main" key="ple_cto2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plēcto</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">plh/ttw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n36640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to beat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">punish;</hi> in class. lang. usually in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be punished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffer punishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be beaten.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36640.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (post-class; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. punio): capite aliquem plectere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod.
