Just.</author> 9, 20, 7</bibl></cit>: quae <cb n="PLEN" /> sibi ignoscunt et plectunt deum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 6 praef.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n36640.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36640.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venusinae Plectantur silvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego plectar pendens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tergo plecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 105</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 14</bibl>. ut in suo vitio quisque plectatur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:20:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 20, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in judiciis culpa plectatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jure igitur plectimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:8:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 8, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis in rebus neglegentiā plectimur,</quote> <trans><tr>because of negligence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 26, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inscia quod crimen viderunt lumina, plector,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:5:49" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 5, 49</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insimulationis falsae plecti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 274, 14</bibl></cit>. —With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">morte plectendum est (sc. peccatum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:21:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 21, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36640.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to blame</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavit, ne quā in re jure plecteretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 116</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
plectrifer: <entryFree id="n36641" type="main" key="plectri^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plectrĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>plectrumfero</etym>, <sense id="n36641.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">carrying the plectrum</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Dracont.</author> Carm. 10, 285</bibl> Duhn.</sense></entryFree>
plectripotens: <entryFree id="n36642" type="main" key="plectri^po^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plectrĭpŏtens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>plectrumpotens</etym>, <sense id="n36642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">master of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">skilful with the plectrum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">great in lyric poetry</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plectrum: <entryFree id="n36643" type="greek" key="ple_ctrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plēctrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">plh=ktron</foreign> (an instrument to strike with; esp.), <sense id="n36643.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little stick with which the player struck the chords of a stringed instrument</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a quill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plectrum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque plectri similem linguam nostri solent dicere, chordarum dentis, naris cornibus illis qui resonant, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:59:149" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 59, 149</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 168</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plectra movere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 113</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36643.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., <hi rend="ital">a lyre</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lute;</hi> also <hi rend="ital">a lyric poem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lyric poetry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plectro modulatus eburno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:39" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et te sonantem plenius aureo, Alcaee, plectro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 26, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36643.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A helm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rudder</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">non plectro ratis Parcitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:549" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 549</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:403" default="NO">403</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pleias: <entryFree id="n36644" type="main" key="Ple_ias"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Plēïas</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Plējas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dissyl.</orth>）<itype />, (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Plī^as</orth>), <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*plhi+a/s</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">*pleia/s</foreign>. <sense id="n36644.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the Seven Stars</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Pleiad;</hi> usually in <number>plur.</number>: Pleiades (Pliades) = <foreign lang="greek">*pleia/des</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the constellation of the Seven Stars</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Pleiades</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Pleiads</hi> (pure Lat. Vergiliae), acc. to the myth, <hi rend="ital">the seven daughters of Atlas and Pleione</hi> (Electra, Halcyone, Celaeno, Maia, Sterope, Taygete, and Merope): <cit><quote lang="la">Pleïas enixa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:670" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 670</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Plias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:6:22" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 6, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:105" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 105</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Plĭadum nivosum Sidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:95" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 3, 95</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36644.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., <hi rend="ital">a storm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:268" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 268</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:405" default="NO">2, 405</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pliada movere,</quote> <trans><tr>to cause the Pleiads to rise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:357" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 357</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pleione: <entryFree id="n36645" type="main" key="Ple_i^o^ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Plēĭŏnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*plhi+o/nh</foreign>. <sense id="n36645.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A daughter of Oceanus and Tethys</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wife of Atlas and mother of the Pleiades</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc sata Pleione cum caelifero Atlante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:83" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:21" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pleiones nepos,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>Mercury</tr>, <tr>son of Maia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:738" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 738</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36645.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The constellation of the Pleiades</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:67" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 67</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plemmyrium: <entryFree id="n36646" type="main" key="Plemmy^ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Plemmyrĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Plēmyrĭ</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*plhmmu/rion</foreign>, <sense id="n36646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a promontory of Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Syracuse</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Punta di Gigante</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">undosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:693" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 693</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
plene: <entryFree id="n36647" type="main" key="ple_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plēnē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. plenus <sense id="n36647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
plenilunium: <entryFree id="n36648" type="main" key="ple_ni^lu_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plēnĭlūnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. tempus) [plenus-luna], <sense id="n36648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the full moon</hi> (post-Aug. for luna plena), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:85" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 85</bibl>: cum vero occidente sole orietur ex adverso, ita ut pariter aspiciantur; <cit><quote lang="la">tunc erit plenilunium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:323" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 32, 75, § 323</bibl></cit>; in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 15, 20, § 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plenitas: <entryFree id="n36649" type="main" key="ple_ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plēnĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>plenus</etym>, <sense id="n36649.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a being full</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repletion</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n36649.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes propter plenitatem et gravitatem liquescendo disperguntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 9, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36649.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">abundance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">copiousness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">humoris plenitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
plenitudo: <entryFree id="n36650" type="main" key="ple_ni^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plēnĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a being full</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plenitude</hi> (generally post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n36650.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Completeness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plenitudo syllabarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 20, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36650.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Fulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae (i.e. frugum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:33:16 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 33, 16 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n36650.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Thickness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stoutness</hi>, e. g. of a rod, of a man (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:30:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 30, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 87, § 216</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plenus: <entryFree id="n36651" type="main" key="ple_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plēnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>from the root ple-; Sanscr. prā-, to fill; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pla-</foreign> in <foreign lang="greek">pi/mplhmi, plh/qw</foreign>; Lat. plerus, plebs, populus, etc.; whence compleo, expleo, suppleo</etym>, <sense id="n36651.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filled</hi> with any thing (class.; cf.: refertus, oppletus). </sense><sense id="n36651.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36651.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rimarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus suci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallia est plena civium Romanorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus plena caelati argenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 14</bibl></cit>. § <cit><quote lang="la">35: vini, somni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. in Sen. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <pb n="1387" /> <cb n="PLEN" /> stellarum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:11:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 11, 11</bibl>.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">plena domus ornamentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:57:section=126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 57, § 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita plena et conferta voluptatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plenum pueris gymnasium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">auditorium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:11:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plenissimis velis navigare,</quote> <trans><tr>with swelling sails</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 10, 24</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">plēnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">space occupied by matter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a plenum</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 37, 118</bibl>.—Adverb.: ad plenum, <hi rend="ital">to repletion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">copiously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundantly</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 244</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic tibi copia Manabit ad plenum benigno Ruris honorum opulenta cornu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 17, 15</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophiae scientiam ad plenum adeptus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 8, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36651.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n36651.4" n="1" level="3"> Of bodily size, <hi rend="ital">stout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bulky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">portly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plump</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corpulent</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pleni enective simus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:69:142" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 69, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulpecula pleno corpore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigus inimicum est tenui: at prodest omnibus plenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">femina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:661" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 661</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tauros palea ac feno facere pleniores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 12</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plenissimus quisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36651.5" n="b" level="4"> Of females, <hi rend="ital">big</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with child</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pregnant</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">et cum te gravidam et cum te pulchre plenam aspicio, gaudeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">femina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:469" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 469</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:413" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 413</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sus plena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:45:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 45, 101</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Telluri plenae victima plena datur (preceded by gravida),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:634" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 634</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36651.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Filled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satisfied</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 6, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plenus cum languet amator,</quote> <trans><tr>sated with reading</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illa bibit sitiens lector, mea pocula plenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:4:55" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 4, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36651.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Full packed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laden;</hi> with <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrupedes pleni dominis armisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:812" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 812</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus plenissimus praedā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crura thymo plenae (apes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 181</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:14:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 14, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36651.8" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Entire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complete</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whole</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut haberet ad praeturam gerendam plenum annum atque integrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:23:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 23, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:12:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 12, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pleno aratro sulcare,</quote> <trans><tr>with the whole plough sunk in the ground</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:25" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sustineas ut onus, nitendum vertice pleno est, i. e. toto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:7:77" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 7, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pleno gradu,</quote> <trans><tr>at full pace</tr>, <tr>at storming pace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 32</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> adverb.: in plenum, <hi rend="ital">on the whole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">generally</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 7, § 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 91:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 91, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36651.9" n="5" level="3"> Of the voice, <hi rend="ital">sonorous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loud</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vox grandior et plenior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:84:289" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 84, 289</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voce plenior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:29:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 29, 132</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36651.10" n="6" level="3"> Of letters, syllables, words, <hi rend="ital">full</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at full length</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not contracted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unabridged</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pleniores syllabae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 20, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut E plenissimum dicas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:12:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 12, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siet plenum est, sit imminutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:47:157" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 47, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plenissima verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 290</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36651.11" n="7" level="3"> Of food and drink, <hi rend="ital">strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hearty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">substantial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pleniores cibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36651.12" n="8" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Full</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plentiful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">much</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tam Siciliam, quam inanem offenderant, quam Verrem ipsum, qui plenus decesserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:4:section=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 4, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:37:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 37, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia,</quote> <trans><tr>much money</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:738" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 738</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">serius potius ad nos, dum plenior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tres uno die a te accepi litteras, unam brevem, duas pleniores,</quote> <trans><tr>fuller</tr>, <tr>larger</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plenissima villa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36651.13" n="9" level="3"> Of age, <hi rend="ital">full</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advanced</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ripe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mature</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam plenis nubilis annis,</quote> <trans><tr>marriageable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plenus vitā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:2:129" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 2, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annis,</quote> <trans><tr>full of years</tr>, <tr>that has reached extreme old age</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plenior annis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:376" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 376</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus vicesimus quintus coeptus pro pleno habetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:4:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 4, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36651.14" n="10" level="3"> Law t. t.: pleno jure, <hi rend="ital">with a complete legal title</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proinde pleno jure incipit, id est et in bonis et ex jure Quiritium, tua res esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:41" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pleno jure heres fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:ib. 3:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 85</bibl></cit> al.—</sense><sense id="n36651.15" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">full</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filled.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36651.16" n="A" level="2"> In gen., with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: plenus fidei, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 1, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 342 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">jejunitatis plenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viti probrique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraudis, sceleris, parricidi, perjuri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">offici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negoti,</quote> <trans><tr>full of business</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 20, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 146</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 19, 22, § 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae regio in terris nostri non plena laboris?</quote> <trans><tr>is not full of our disaster?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:460" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 460</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">plenus sum exspectatione de Pompeio,</quote> <trans><tr>full of expectation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 1, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36651.17" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n36651.18" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Complete</hi>, <hi rend="ital">finished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ample</hi>, <cb n="PLER" /> <hi rend="ital">copious</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">orator plenus atque perfectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:13:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 13, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plenior, opp. to jejunior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio plenior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pleniora scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36651.19" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Full of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abounding</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rich in</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">plenum bonarum rerum oppidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis plenior inimicorum fuit C. Mario?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 8, 19</bibl></cit>: pleniore ore laudare, <hi rend="ital">with fuller mouth</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">more heartily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:18:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 18, 61</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">plēnē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n36651.20" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">full</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">vasa plene infundere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 22, 28, § 139</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36651.21" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">fully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wholly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">completely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thorougnly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">largely</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">plene cumulateque aliquid perficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plene perfectae munitiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid vitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plene sapientes homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestare aliquid,</quote> <trans><tr>perfectly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 14</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plenius facere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:11:20" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 11, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis illud plenissime, hoc restrictissime feceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 8, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pleo: <entryFree id="n36652" type="gloss" key="ple^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n36652.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fulfil</hi>, the root of plenus, q. v., compleo, expleo, suppleo: <cit><quote lang="la">plentur antiqui etiam sine praepositionibus dicebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=230" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 230</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
pleonasmus: <entryFree id="n36653" type="main" key="ple^o^nasmus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plĕŏnasmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pleonasmo/s</foreign>, in gram., <sense id="n36653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pleonasm</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 537 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
plerique: <entryFree id="n36654" type="main" key="ple_ri_que"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plērīque</orth>, <itype>raeque, răque</itype>, v. plerusque.</entryFree>
pleroma: <entryFree id="n36655" type="main" key="ple_ro_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plērōma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">plh/rwma</foreign>, <sense id="n36655.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fulness</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pleromarius: <entryFree id="n36656" type="gloss" key="ple_ro_ma_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plērōmārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pleroma</etym>, <sense id="n36656.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seaman</hi> in large ships of burden or of war (opp. to lenuncularius), <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4104</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pleroticus: <entryFree id="n36657" type="greek" key="ple_ro_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plērōtĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">plhrwtiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36657.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">serving to fill out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complemental</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">termini plerotici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Colon. p. 131" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Colon. p. 131</bibl></cit> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
plerumque: <entryFree id="n36658" type="main" key="ple_rumque"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plērumque</orth>, v. plerusque.</entryFree>
plerus: <entryFree id="n36659" type="main" key="ple_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plērus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root ple-, v. plenus</etym>, <sense id="n36659.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very many</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a very great part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">most</hi> (anteclass. prim. form, for the class. plerusque, plerique): ager, campestris plerus, <hi rend="ital">for the most part</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 668</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">pater Achaeos in Caphareis saxis pleros perdidit, Pac. ib.: plera pars,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> and ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=230" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 230</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">minores magistratus partiti iuris ploeres in ploera sunto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> adverb.: plerum (like plerumque, v. plerusque), <hi rend="ital">for the most part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mostly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commonly</hi>: fieri solet plerum, ut, etc., Asell. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 668</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
plerusque: <entryFree id="n36660" type="main" key="ple_rusque"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plērusque</orth>, <itype>răque, rumque</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>a strengthened form from plerus</etym>, <sense id="n36660.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very many</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a very great part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the most</hi>, <hi rend="ital">most</hi> (rare in <number>sing.</number>, and only in Sall. and post-class. writers; but in <number>plur.</number> freq. in all periods and styles). </sense><sense id="n36660.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">habent hunc morem plerique argentarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pleraeque hae (meretrices) sub vestimentis secum habebant retia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi nihil prodesse philosophiam, plerique etiam obesse arbitrantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:36:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 36, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut plerique meministis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerique Belgae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pleraeque boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pleraque tecta ... alia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 3</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerique e Graecis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerisque ex factione ejus corruptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 29, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">omnes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">almost all</hi>: plerique omnes subiguntur sub suum judicium, Naev. ap. Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 28</bibl> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:Klussmann, p. 80" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> Klussmann, p. 80</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">plerique omnes adulescentuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:ib. 1:1:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dixi pleraque omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:Heaut. 4:7:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 7, 2</bibl></cit>.—Less emphatically, <hi rend="ital">a considerable part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very many</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapti e publico plerique, plures in tabernis intercepti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 86</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">like plures: non dubito fore plerosque, qui hoc genus scripturae leve judicent, Nep. praef. 1: pleraque testimonia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tim. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deum ipsum multi Aesculapium, quidam Osirim, plerique Iovem, plurimi Ditem patrem conjectant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> H 4, 84 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerique nostrūm oratorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:42:143" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 42, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Poenorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:6:section=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 6, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:42:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 42, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum plerique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 20, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 74:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 74, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbium pleraeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum plerique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:21:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 21, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 21, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legentium, Liv. praef. 4: Graecorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 5</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Gen. plur.</hi> (rare and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">scientia plerarumque litterarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">plērăque</orth>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">all</hi>, <hi rend="ital">every thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ratione animi quicquam, sed pleraque viribus corporis administrabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—Also, <hi rend="ital">the most</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the greatest</hi> <cb n="PLIC" /> <hi rend="ital">part.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pleraque ejus insulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:8:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 8, 15</bibl></cit>. —<orth extent="full" lang="la">plērăque</orth>, adverb., <hi rend="ital">mostly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for the most part</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">is erit pleraque impeccabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:19:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 19, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36660.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: juventus pleraque Catilinae favebat, <hi rend="ital">the greatest</hi> or <hi rend="ital">largest part</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 17, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pleraque nobilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 23, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā tempestate Carthaginienses pleraeque Africae imperitabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 79:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 79, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum plerumque opperiri jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 54:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 54, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:21" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comae pleramque contegebant faciem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 231, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">plērum-que</orth>, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the greatest part</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi plerumque noctis processit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Europae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 41, 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:4:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 4, 2</bibl>.—More freq.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">plērumquē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">for the most part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mostly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commonly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very often</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very frequently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ipsa fortuita sunt: plerumque enim non semper eveniunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:5:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerumque casu, saepe naturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:51:170" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 51, 170</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 7, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ridiculum acri Fortius et melius magnas plerumque secat res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi plerumque gradus,</quote> <trans><tr>usually</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:46" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 46</bibl></cit>.—Post-Aug., in a less emphatic sense, <hi rend="ital">often</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frequently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerumque permoveor, num ad ipsum referri verius sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:14:25" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 14, 25</bibl> and 26.</sense></entryFree>
plestina: <entryFree id="n36661" type="main" key="Plestina"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Plestina</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n36661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of the Marsi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 3, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pletura: <entryFree id="n36662" type="main" key="ple_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plētūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pleo</etym>. <sense id="n36662.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">fulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a filling</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 21, 47</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36662.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">fulness of blood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excess of blood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plethora</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pleumosii: <entryFree id="n36663" type="main" key="Pleumosi^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pleumosĭi</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pleumoxĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36663.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Belgic Gaul</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pleuricus: <entryFree id="n36664" type="greek" key="pleuri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pleurĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">pleuriko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36664.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">on the side</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lateral</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">termini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Colon. p. 117" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Colon. p. 117</bibl></cit> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
pleurisis: <entryFree id="n36665" type="main" key="pleuri^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pleurĭsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, for pleuritis, <sense id="n36665.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pleurisy</hi> (post-class.), Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 484; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 4, 6, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pleuriticus: <entryFree id="n36666" type="greek" key="pleuri_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pleurītĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">pleuritiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36666.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">affected with pleurisy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleuritic</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">medentur pleuriticis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 4, 3, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">passio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:16:100" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 16, 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 4, 6, 8</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pleurītĭci</orth>, <hi rend="ital">pleuritic patients</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 5, 15, § 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:16:100" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 16, 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:2:17:102" default="NO">2, 17, 102</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pleuritis: <entryFree id="n36667" type="greek" key="pleuri_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pleurītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pleuri=?tis</foreign>. <sense id="n36667.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sharp pain in the side</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleurisy</hi> (pure Lat. dolor lateris): <cit><quote lang="la">arthritis, tussis, pleuritis, phthisis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36667.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The register</hi> in a hydraulic organ, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 13</bibl> dub. (al. plinthis).</sense></entryFree>
pleuron: <entryFree id="n36668" type="main" key="Pleuron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pleuron</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pleurw/n</foreign>, <sense id="n36668.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Ætolia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Castle of Irene</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 2, 3, § 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:727" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 727</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 382</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pleurōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pleurw/nios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pleuron</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pleuronian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pleuronius Acmon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:494" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 494</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pleurōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Ætolia</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">that part of Ætolia in which Pleuron is situated</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epit. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plexippus: <entryFree id="n36669" type="main" key="Plexippus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Plexippus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*plh/cippos</foreign>. <sense id="n36669.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the fifty sons of Ægyptus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 170" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 170</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36669.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Thestius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 173" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 173</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plexus: <entryFree id="n36670" type="main" key="plexus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plexus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from 1. plecto.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36671" type="hapax" key="plexus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plexus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. plecto</etym>, <sense id="n36671.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a twining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plaiting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">braid</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 147</bibl> dub. (al. flexum, fluctum).</sense></entryFree>
plias: <entryFree id="n36672" type="main" key="Plias"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Plias</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pliades</orth>, v. Pleias.</entryFree>
plicatilis: <entryFree id="n36673" type="main" key="pli^ca_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plĭcātĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>plico</etym>, <sense id="n36673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be folded together</hi> or <hi rend="ital">doubled up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flexible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pliable</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">upupae crista,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 44, § 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 9, 10, § 59</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
plicatrix: <entryFree id="n36674" type="main" key="pli^ca_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plĭcātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>plicator</etym>, <sense id="n36674.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who folds clothes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 101</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plicatura: <entryFree id="n36675" type="main" key="pli^ca_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plĭcātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>plico</etym>, <sense id="n36675.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a folding</hi> or <hi rend="ital">doubling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plicature</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 51, 52, § 171</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
plicitus: <entryFree id="n36676" type="main" key="pli^ci^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plĭcĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from plico.</entryFree>
plico: <entryFree id="n36677" type="main" key="pli^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plĭco</orth> (plĭcāvi, plĭcui, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 680</bibl> P.), plĭcātum and <itype>plĭcĭtum, āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root plic-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ple/kw</foreign>; v. plecto</etym>, <sense id="n36677.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lay</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wind together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fold up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">double up</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">complico, plecto, necto, flecto),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:828" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 828</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam plicata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1086" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1086</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chartam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:83:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 83, 7</bibl></cit>: seque in sua membra plicantem (anguem), <hi rend="ital">winding</hi> or <hi rend="ital">coiling himself up</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 279</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:9:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 9, 9</bibl>: decas plena his quattuor numeris gradatim plicatis integratur, <hi rend="ital">folded</hi> <pb n="1388" /> <cb n="PLOR" /> <hi rend="ital">together</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">added</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 734</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostiola plicabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:41:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 41, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et cum plicuisset librum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 4, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
plinius: <entryFree id="n36678" type="main" key="Pli_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Plīnĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Pliny</hi>, <hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens. The most celebrated are, </sense><sense id="n36678.1" n="I" level="1"> C. Plinius Secundus, also called Major (the Elder), <hi rend="ital">author of an encyclopedical work in</hi> 37 <hi rend="ital">books</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who lost his life in an eruption of Vesuvius</hi>, A. D. 79.—</sense><sense id="n36678.2" n="II" level="1"> His nephew, C. Plinius Caecilius, also called Junior (the Younger), <hi rend="ital">author of Letters and a Pane gyric on the emperor Trajan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:19:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 19, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36678.3" n="III" level="1"> Plinius Valerianus, <hi rend="ital">a physician in the time of the emperor Constantine.</hi>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Plīnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">belonging to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">named after a Pling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Plinian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 25, 30, § 103</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
plinthis: <entryFree id="n36679" type="greek" key="plinthis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plinthis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">plinqi/s</foreign> (a square tile). <sense id="n36679.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A square;</hi> in architect., <hi rend="ital">a square base</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a plinth</hi>, for plinthus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 3, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in land-surveying, for plinthus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Condit. Agror. p. 210" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Condit. Agror. p. 210</bibl></cit> Goes.—</sense><sense id="n36679.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">plinthĭ-des</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a register</hi> in the hydraulic organ, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 8, 8</bibl>; v. pleuritis.</sense></entryFree>
plinthium: <entryFree id="n36680" type="greek" key="plinthi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plinthĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pli/nqion</foreign>, <sense id="n36680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hollow square figure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of sundial</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plinthus: <entryFree id="n36681" type="greek" key="plinthus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plinthus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> and <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pli/nqos</foreign> (a tile). <sense id="n36681.0" n="I" level="1"> In archit., <hi rend="ital">the large flat member under the inferior moulding of a column</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the base</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plinth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 7, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n36681.1" n="II" level="1"> In land-surveying, <hi rend="ital">a tile-shaped figure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">containing a hundred acres of land</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae centuriae nunc appellantur plinthi, id est laterculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Condit. Agror. p. 205" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Condit. Agror. p. 205</bibl></cit> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
plisima: <entryFree id="n36682" type="main" key="plisi^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plisĭma</orth>, <sense id="n36682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> form for plurima; v. plurimus, under multus, III.</sense></entryFree>
plisthenes: <entryFree id="n36683" type="main" key="Plisthe^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Plisthĕnes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pleisqe/nhs</foreign>. <sense id="n36683.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The son of Pelops</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brother of Atreus and Thyestes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and the father of Agamemnon and Menelaus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who were brought up by his brother Atreus</hi> (whence they are called Atridae), <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 458</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">acc. to others,</quote> <trans><tr>the son of Atreus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 86" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 86</bibl></cit> and 97.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36683.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Plisthĕnĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pleisqeni/dhs</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a male descendant of Plisthenes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Plisthenide</hi>: felix Plisthenide, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Menelaus</hi>, Sabin. Ep. 1, 107.—</sense><sense id="n36683.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Plisthĕ-nĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Plisthenes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Plisthenian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Plisthenius torus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Agamemnon</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 778</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36683.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The son of Thyestes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 726" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 726</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 88" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 88</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plistia: <entryFree id="n36684" type="main" key="Plisti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Plistĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n36684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of the Samnites</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22" default="NO" valid="yes">22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plistolochia: <entryFree id="n36685" type="greek" key="plisto^lo^chi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plistŏlŏchĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n36685.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant facilitaling parturition</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 54, § 96</bibl> (al. pistolochia); 25, 8, 55, § 101.—</sense><sense id="n36685.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, = althaea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 21, 84, § 222</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plistonices: <entryFree id="n36686" type="main" key="Plisto^ni_ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Plistŏnīces</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an epithet of Apion the grammarian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:14:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 19, § 75</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plitendum: <entryFree id="n36687" type="main" key="Plitendum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Plitendum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n36687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Asia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 18, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ploce: <entryFree id="n36688" type="main" key="plo^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plŏcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">plokh/</foreign>. <sense id="n36688.0" n="I" level="1"> In rhetoric, <hi rend="ital">a repeating of the same word with a different meaning</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 532</bibl>; Jul. <bibl default="NO"><author>Rufin.</author> p. 236</bibl> Ruhnk. (ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 41</bibl>, written as Greek).—</sense><sense id="n36688.1" n="II" level="1"> In music, <hi rend="ital">a combining of different tones together</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9</bibl>, §§ 936, 958.</sense></entryFree>
plodo: <entryFree id="n36689" type="main" key="plo_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plōdo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. plaudo.</entryFree>
ploeres: <entryFree id="n36690" type="main" key="ploeres"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ploeres</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ploera</orth>, <itype>archaic for plures, plura</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 6</bibl> B. and K.</entryFree>
plorabilis: <entryFree id="n36691" type="main" key="plo_ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plōrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ploro</etym>, <sense id="n36691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lamentable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deplorable</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">plorabile si quid Eliquat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:34" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plorabile quiddam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 1, 261</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ploratio: <entryFree id="n36692" type="main" key="plo_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plōrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wailing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weeping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lamentation</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">a convalle plorationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. S. S. 17" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. S. S. 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
plorator: <entryFree id="n36693" type="main" key="plo_ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plōrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36693.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wailer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lamenter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mourner</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:54:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 54, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ploratus: <entryFree id="n36694" type="main" key="plo_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plōrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36694.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wailing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weeping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lamenting.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36694.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">virginalem ploratum edere, Cic. poët. Tusc. 2, 9, 21: ploratum infantis cohibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox ploratūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 2, 18</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia mulierum ploratibus sonant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36694.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the <hi rend="ital">weeping</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bleeding</hi> of a tree, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 25, 54, § 116</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ploro: <entryFree id="n36695" type="main" key="plo_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plōro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n36695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [etym. dub.; cf. pluo]. </sense><sense id="n36695.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To cry out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cry aloud</hi> = clamare: SI PARENTEM PVER VERBERIT. AST OLLE PLORASSIT, <hi rend="ital">and he cry out</hi>, Lex. Serv. Tull. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=230" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 230</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n36695.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To wail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lament</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to weep aloud.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36695.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> <cb n="PLUM" /> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: lugeo, fleo): ego hercle faciam plorantem illum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne plora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam plorare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:prol. 8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. prol. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plorando fessus sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 9</bibl></cit>: date puero panem, ne ploret, Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimandum est, non plorandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 63:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 63, 1</bibl></cit>: jubeo te plorare, <hi rend="ital">I bid you howl</hi> (in a double sense, alluding to their lachrymose poetry and to the chastisement its authors deserve), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 91</bibl>.—With <case>dat.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">before</hi> one: <cit><quote lang="la">ille suae (puellae) plorabit sobrius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:103" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plorabo tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:48:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 48, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36695.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: mimus quis melior plorante gulā, <hi rend="ital">a complaining</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clamorous appetite</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:158" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 158</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">at tu, victrix provincia, ploras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36695.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to weep over</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">to lament</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bewail</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n36695.6" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpe commissum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">raptum juvenem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:245" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 245</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam multi talia plorent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:150" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 150</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:134" default="NO">15, 134</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rachel plorans filios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 2, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:31:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Jer. 31, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36695.7" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam hercle plorat, quom lavat, profundere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ploravere, suis non respondere favorem Speratum meritis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me tamen obicere incolis Plorares Aquilonibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:10:3 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 10, 3 sq.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
plosor: <entryFree id="n36696" type="main" key="plo_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plōsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, v. plausor.</entryFree>
plostellum: <entryFree id="n36697" type="main" key="plostellum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plostellum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>plostrum, plaustrum</etym>, <sense id="n36697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small wagon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cart</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plostellum Poenicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:52" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plostello adjungere mures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 247</bibl></cit>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 7, 21.</sense></entryFree>
plostrarius: <entryFree id="n36698" type="main" key="plostra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plostrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. plaustrarius.</entryFree>
plostrum: <entryFree id="n36699" type="main" key="plostrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plostrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. plaustrum.</entryFree>
plosus: <entryFree id="n36700" type="main" key="plo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plōsus</orth>, v. plausus.</entryFree>
plotae: <entryFree id="n36701" type="main" key="Plo_tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Plōtae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n36701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient name of the Strophades</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 19, § 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plotinus: <entryFree id="n36702" type="main" key="Plo_ti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Plōtīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*plwti=nos</foreign>, <sense id="n36702.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a famous philosopher of the Eclectic school</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who flourished in the third century</hi> A. D., <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 14, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ploxemum: <entryFree id="n36703" type="foreign" key="ploxe^mum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ploxĕmum</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ploxĭmum</orth>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">plo-xĕnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Gallic</etym>, <sense id="n36703.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wagon-box</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gingivas vero ploxemi habet veteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:97:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 97, 6</bibl></cit> (quoted ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 8</bibl>, and ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=230" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 230</bibl> Müll.).</sense></entryFree>
pluit: <entryFree id="n36704" type="main" key="plu^it"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plŭit</orth>, v. pluo.</entryFree>
pluma: <entryFree id="n36705" type="main" key="plu_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plūma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n36705.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soft feather;</hi> in <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">fine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soft feathers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">down.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36705.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (clas.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. penna): (animantium) pluma alias, alias squamā videmus obductas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plumae versicolores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:5:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in plumis delituisse Jovem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in the form of a swan</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 8, 68</bibl></cit>.—They were used esp. for stuffing pillows and the beds of litters: <cit><quote lang="la">dormit in plumā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:17:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 17, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pensilibus plumis vehi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in litters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:159" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in plumā paternā dormire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 88</bibl></cit>. —Also in clothing: <cit><quote lang="la">non avium plumae in usum vestium conseruntur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 14</bibl></cit>.—As an image of lightness, triviality, insignificance, like <hi rend="ital">feather</hi> with us: <cit><quote lang="la">homo levior quam pluma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levior plumā est gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi plumā aut folio facilius moventur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pluma haud interest, patronus, an cliens probior siet,</quote> <trans><tr>there is not a pin to choose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36705.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36705.3" n="A" level="2"> Of the first beard, <hi rend="ital">down</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">insperata tuae cum veniet pluma superbiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 10, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36705.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The scales</hi> on a coat of mail, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:542" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 542</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">equus, quem pellis aënis In plumam squamis auro conserta tegebat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>scales of brass overlaid
