on a skin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:771" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 771</bibl></cit> Serv. and Heyn. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">equis operimenta erant, quae lintea ferreis laminis in modum plumae adnexuerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 4, 59</bibl></cit> Dietsch.</sense></entryFree>
plumacium: <entryFree id="n36706" type="main" key="plu_ma_ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plūmācĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pluma</etym>, <sense id="n36706.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a feather pillow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">down pillow</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 26</bibl>, n. 12; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 7, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plumalis: <entryFree id="n36707" type="main" key="plu_ma_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plūmālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36707.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">feathered</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). —Of Leda: plumalem de Jove fecit avem (Jupiter, who, for love of her, changed himself into a swan), Poët. in <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 3, 275, 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plumarius: <entryFree id="n36708" type="main" key="plu_ma_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plūmārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36708.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to soft feathers;</hi> transf., <hi rend="ital">embroidered with feathers</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes plumariā arte contextae,</quote> <trans><tr>the art of embroidering</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 29</bibl></cit>, n. 6; <cit><quote lang="la">Adelh. Laud. Virg. 15: ars,</quote> <trans><tr>embroidery</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:39:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 39, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36708.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">plūmārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an embroiderer</hi>, Varr. <cb n="PLUM" /> ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 162, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plumariorum textrinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 7</bibl></cit>; Firm. Math. 3, 13, 10; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:35:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 35, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 649, 8</bibl>; Inscr. Rein. cl. 11, n. 114.</sense></entryFree>
plumatile: <entryFree id="n36709" type="main" key="plu_ma_ti^le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plūmātĭle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. vestimentum) [from pluma; embroidered like feathers], <sense id="n36709.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an embroidered garment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cumatile aut plumatile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 49</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
plumatus: <entryFree id="n36710" type="main" key="plu_ma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plūmātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <sense id="n36710.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P.a.</hi>, from plumo, q. v.</sense></entryFree>
plumbago: <entryFree id="n36711" type="main" key="plumba_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plumbāgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>plumbum</etym>. <sense id="n36711.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A species of lead ore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">black-lead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plumbago</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> molybdaena, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 18, 50, § 168</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36711.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a leaden color</hi> in gems, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 18, § 68</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36711.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> molybdaena, <hi rend="ital">leadwort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fleawort</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 97, § 155</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plumbarius: <entryFree id="n36712" type="main" key="plumba_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plumbārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36712.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to lead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lead-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">artifices plumbarii,</quote> <trans><tr>workers in lead</tr>, <tr>plumbers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officinae,</quote> <trans><tr>plumbers' shops</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 18, 54, § 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metallum,</quote> <trans><tr>a lead-mine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 7, 40, § 119</bibl></cit>.— <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n36712.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">plumbārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. artifex), <hi rend="ital">a plumber; plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:6:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 6, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36712.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">plumbārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a place to keep leaden vessels in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plumbum, plumbeus, plumbarium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 164</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
plumbatae: <entryFree id="n36713" type="main" key="plumba_tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plumbātae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, v. plumbo, II. B.</entryFree>
plumbatura: <entryFree id="n36714" type="main" key="plumba_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plumbātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>plumbo</etym>, <sense id="n36714.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a soldering with lead</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:1:23:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 6, 1, 23, § 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plumbeus: <entryFree id="n36715" type="main" key="plumbe^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plumbĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>plumbum</etym>, <sense id="n36715.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to lead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">made of lead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leaden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lead-.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36715.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">plumbea glans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:306" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 306</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pistillum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 18, 50, § 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 6, 35, § 109</bibl></cit>: ictus, <hi rend="ital">blows given with a scourge to which a leaden ball is attached</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 122.—<pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n36715.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">plum-bĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a leaden vessel</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 105</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nicerotiana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:55:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 55, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36715.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">plum-bĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a leaden ball</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mortuus ictu plumbeae crederetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Sever. 11, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n36715.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36715.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Leaden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blunt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dull</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">plumbeo gladio jugulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o plumbeum pugionem!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:18:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 18, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36715.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Leaden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worthless</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nummus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 120</bibl>: faber, qui cudere soles plumbeos nummos, <hi rend="ital">to coin leaden money</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">bad jokes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 4, 2, 11</bibl>; so, plumbei, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> (sc. nummi), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:74:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 74, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:49:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 49, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:94:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 94, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36715.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Leaden</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">heavy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oppressive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burdensome</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nec plumbeus Auster Auctumnusque gravis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36715.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36715.9" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Leaden</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">heavy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weighty</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">si quid peccatum est, plumbeas iras gerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 6, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36715.10" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Leaden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stolid</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">caudex, stipes, asinus, plumbeus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi plane in physicis plumbei sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:29:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 29, 71</bibl></cit>: cor, <hi rend="ital">without feeling</hi>, Licin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plumbo: <entryFree id="n36716" type="main" key="plumbo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plumbo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n36716.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To lead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to solder with lead</hi> (ante-class. and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">modiolos indet et plumbet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 17, 48, § 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scyphum alieno plumbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:27" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 1, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36716.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To make</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">of lead;</hi> hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">plumbātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, <hi rend="ital">leaden</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">plumbatae sagittae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 33, 50, § 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 124" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 7</bibl></cit>, n. 2. —</sense><sense id="n36716.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">plumbātae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n36716.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Leaden balls</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 1, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36716.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Scourges to which leaden balls are attached</hi>: plumbatarum ictus, Cod. Th. 9, 35, 2.</sense></entryFree>
plumbosus: <entryFree id="n36717" type="main" key="plumbo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plumbōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36717.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of lead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having much lead mixed with it</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">plumbosa molybdaena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 18, 53, § 173</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">faex plumbosissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 6, 34, § 103</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
plumbum: <entryFree id="n36718" type="main" key="plumbum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plumbum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>for mlumbum; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">mo/lmbos, mo/lubdos</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n36718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lead.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36718.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36718.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">dolia plumbo vincito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plumbum album,</quote> <trans><tr>tin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1079" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1079</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 12</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also candidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 16, 47, § 157</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">but plumbum nigrum,</quote> <trans><tr>lead</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 16, 47, § 159</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36718.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n36718.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A leaden ball</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bullet</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Balearica plumbum Funda jacit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:727" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 727</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:587" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 587</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36718.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Leaden pipes</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">purior in vicis aqua tendit rumpere plumbum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36718.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A scourge with a leaden ball at the end of it</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10. 116.—</sense><sense id="n36718.7" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A pencil</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ruler</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">membrana plumbo directa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 22, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36718.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a defect in the eye</hi> (post-Aug.): <pb n="1389" /> <cb n="PLUR" /> plumbum (quod est genus vitii) ex oculo tollitur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 97, § 155</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plumella: <entryFree id="n36719" type="gloss" key="plu_mella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plūmella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>pluma</etym>, <sense id="n36719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small feather</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pluma, plumella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 171</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
plumesco: <entryFree id="n36720" type="main" key="plu_mesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plūmesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n36720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to begin to have</hi> or <hi rend="ital">get feathers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become fledged</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 53, 74, § 149</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Matt. 24, § 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plumeus: <entryFree id="n36721" type="main" key="plu_me^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plūmĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n36721.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">downy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covered</hi> or <hi rend="ital">filled with down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">down-</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">culcita plumea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 19, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 23, 33, § 68</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36721.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36721.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Downy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like down</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delicate</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">plumea pondera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:19:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 19, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nives,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plumea et lactea cutis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 135, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36721.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Embroidered</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">indumenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 295</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
plumiger: <entryFree id="n36722" type="main" key="plu_mi^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plūmĭger</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pluma-gero</etym>, <sense id="n36722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">feather-bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feathered</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">plumigeri anseres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 22, 27, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">series, i. e. pennae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 3, 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
plumipes: <entryFree id="n36723" type="main" key="plu_mi^pes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plūmĭpes</orth>, <itype>ĕdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pluma-pes</etym>, <sense id="n36723.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">feather-footed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with feathered feet</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">adde huc plumipedas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:55:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 55, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
plumo: <entryFree id="n36724" type="main" key="plu_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plūmo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pluma</etym>. <sense id="n36724.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36724.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To cover with feathers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to feather</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">plumato corpore corvus, Cic. poët. N. D. 2, 44, 114: molli plumatā lanugine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 32, 50, § 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plumare se in avem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to transform</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 138, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36724.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To embroider</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pars auro plumata nitet, pars ignea cocco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 123</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Carin. 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plumato amictus aureo Babylonico,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> Poet. 55, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36724.3" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To cover with scales</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">loricae plumatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:2:15" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 41, 2, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36724.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to put forth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">get feathers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become fledged</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">pullis jam jam plumantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:29" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
plumosus: <entryFree id="n36725" type="main" key="plu_mo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plūmōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36725.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of down</hi> or <hi rend="ital">feathers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covered with feathers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feathered.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36725.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aucupium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 2, 34.—</sense><sense id="n36725.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <trans><tr>downy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 6, 29, § 65</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
plumula: <entryFree id="n36726" type="main" key="plu_mu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plūmŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36726.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little downfeather</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a little feather</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 348 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
pluo: <entryFree id="n36727" type="main" key="plu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plŭo</orth>, <itype>plui</itype> (or plūvi in Plaut. and Liv.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 881</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=104" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 104</bibl> Müll.), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, usu. <sense id="n36727.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">impers.</hi> (ante-class. and late Lat. also <hi rend="ital">pers.;</hi> <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>) [root plu-, to swim; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">plu/nw</foreign>, to wash; cf.: <foreign lang="greek">ple/w, pleu/sw</foreign>, to sail; cf. ploro], <hi rend="ital">to rain;</hi> constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, or with <case>abl.</case> or <case>acc.</case> </sense><sense id="n36727.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pluet credo hercle hodie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut multum pluverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. prol. 63</bibl></cit>: has Graeci stellas Hyadas vocitare suerunt, a pluendo: <foreign lang="greek">u(/ein</foreign> enim est pluere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:43:111" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 43, 111</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua, quae pluendo crevisset,</quote> <trans><tr>by the rain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:9:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 9, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoties pluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:179" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urceatim plovebat (vulg. for pluebat),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 44, 18</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem pluisse senatui nuntiatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:27:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 27, 58</bibl></cit> (Klotz, sanguinem): <cit><quote lang="la">lapides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:27:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 27, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:33:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 33, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 9, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Psa. 10, 7</bibl>.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacte pluisse,</quote> <trans><tr>rained milk</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:62:5" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 62, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacte, sanguine, carne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 56, 57, § 147</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā pluitur et ningitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 340, 39</bibl></cit>.—Personally: <cit><quote lang="la">saxis ferunt pluisse caelum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 642</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effigies quae pluit,</quote> <trans><tr>which rained</tr>, <tr>came down in rain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 55, 57, § 147</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n36727.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of other things, <hi rend="ital">to rain</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nec de concussā tantum pluit ilice glandis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stridentia fundae saxa pluunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:416" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 416</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam bellaria adorea pluebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:6:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 6, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pluor: <entryFree id="n36728" type="main" key="plu^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plŭor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pluo</etym>, <sense id="n36728.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rain</hi> (ante-class.): pluor, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 220, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pluralis: <entryFree id="n36729" type="main" key="plu_ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plūrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>plus</etym>, <sense id="n36729.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to more than one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relating to many</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n36729.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n36729.2" n="1" level="3"> Pluralis elocutio testium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:5:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 5, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36729.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Plural</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consisting of more than one</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> in Psa. 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36729.4" n="II" level="1"> In partic., a gram. t. t., <hi rend="ital">plural</hi>: praeterea numeros, in quibus nos singularem ac pluralem habemus, Graeci et <foreign lang="greek">duikon</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">genitivus,</quote> <trans><tr>of the plural</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 26</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum singulari pluralis subjungitur,</quote> <trans><tr>the plural</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singularia pluralibus miscet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:16" default="NO">1, 5, 16</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 28</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">plūrālĭ-ter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the plural</hi>, gram. t. t.: <cit><quote lang="la">tonitrua nos pluraliter dicimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:56:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 56, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:35" default="NO">8, 3, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:28" default="NO">8, 6, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pluralitas: <entryFree id="n36730" type="main" key="plu_ra_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plūrālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pluralis</etym>. <sense id="n36730.0" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Plurality</hi><cb n="PLUT" />  (opp. to unitas), <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl>, prol. § 2; <number>plur.</number>, Boëth. Arithm. 1, 4.—</sense><sense id="n36730.1" n="2" level="3"> Gram. t. t., <hi rend="ital">the plural number</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 50</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
pluraliter: <entryFree id="n36731" type="main" key="plu_ra_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plūrālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. pluralis <sense id="n36731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
plurativus: <entryFree id="n36732" type="main" key="plu_ra_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plūrātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>plus</etym>, <sense id="n36732.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">plural</hi>, gram. t. t. (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">plurativus numerus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:8:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 8, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">plūrātīvum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the plural number</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the plural</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">mei interrogandi casus est, et ab eo declinatur, quod est ego. Hujus deinde plurativum est nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:6:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 6, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
plures: <entryFree id="n36733" type="main" key="plu_res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plūres</orth>, v. plus, under multus, II.</entryFree>
pluries: <entryFree id="n36734" type="hapax" key="plu_ri^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plūrĭes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ens</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>plus</etym>, <sense id="n36734.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">often</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oftentimes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frequently</hi> (post-class.; cf.: saepius, identidem), Treb. Poll. Gall. 1 (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:79:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 79, 1</bibl>, the correct read. is pluresque).</sense></entryFree>
plurifariam: <entryFree id="n36735" type="main" key="plu_ri^fa_ri^am"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plūrĭfārĭam</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36735.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in many parts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">places</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiatoria munera plurifariam exhibuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 21</bibl></cit> (al. plurifaria).—</sense><sense id="n36735.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">In many ways</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifoldly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">variously</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 357, 37</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">p. 178 Bip.: mons Taurus pro gentium ac linguarum varietate plurifariam nominatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
plurifarius: <entryFree id="n36736" type="spur" key="plu_ri^fa_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plūrĭfārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. plurifariam.</entryFree>
pluriformis: <entryFree id="n36737" type="main" key="plu_ri^formis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plūrĭformis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>plures-forma</etym>, <sense id="n36737.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having many forms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">varied</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">pluriformi modo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 341, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 729</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plurilaterus: <entryFree id="n36738" type="main" key="plu_ri^la^te^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plūrĭlătĕrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>plus-latus</etym>, <sense id="n36738.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having several sides</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Expos. Form. p. 35" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Expos. Form. p. 35</bibl> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
plurimus: <entryFree id="n36739" type="main" key="plu_ri^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plūrĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. multus, III.</entryFree>
plurivocus: <entryFree id="n36740" type="main" key="plu_ri^vo^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plūrĭvŏcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>plus-vox</etym>, <sense id="n36740.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having several</hi> or <hi rend="ital">many significations</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeritur quid sit aequivocum, quid univocum, quid, ut ita dicam, plurivocum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4</bibl></cit>, §§ 339, 357.</sense></entryFree>
plus: <entryFree id="n36741" type="main" key="plu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plūs</orth>, <itype>plūris</itype>, v. multus, II.</entryFree>
plusculum: <entryFree id="n36742" type="main" key="pluscu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pluscŭlum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n36742.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
plusculus: <entryFree id="n36743" type="main" key="pluscu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pluscŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n36743.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [plus], <hi rend="ital">somewhat more</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a little more; rather many</hi> (only as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tum pluscula Supellectile opus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 50, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad cujus noctis exemplar similes adstruximus plusculas,</quote> <trans><tr>several nights</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 122, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pyxides,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3</bibl></cit>, p. 138, 25.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr. subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a somewhat larger amount</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plusculum etiam, quam concedit veritas, amori nostro largiare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 3</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plusculum negotii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut plusculum sibi juris populus ascisceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:33:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 33, 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36743.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pluscŭlum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">somewhat more</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rather more</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">invitavit sese in cenā plusculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plusculum annum,</quote> <trans><tr>somewhat more than a year</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laborare,</quote> <trans><tr>too much</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
plusimus: <entryFree id="n36744" type="main" key="plu_si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plūsĭmus</orth>, <itype>for plurimus</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=27" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 27</bibl> Müll.; v. multus, III.</entryFree>
plutearius: <entryFree id="n36745" type="gloss" key="plu^te^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plŭtĕārĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">plŭtĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pluteus</etym>, <sense id="n36745.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maker of balustrades</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Don.</author> 417, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pluteus: <entryFree id="n36746" type="main" key="plu^te^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plŭtĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, less freq. <orth extent="full" lang="la">plŭtĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n36746.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A penthouse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shed</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">mantlet</hi>, made of hurdles covered with raw hides, and used to protect besiegers (cf. vineae): plutei crates corio crudo intentae, quae solebant opponi militibus opus facientibus, et appellabantur militares. Nunc etiam tabulae, quibus quid praesepitur, eodem nomine dicuntur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=231" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 231</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 4, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pluteos praeferre,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 12, 6</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:61:10 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 61, 10 al.</bibl>—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aliquem vineam pluteosque agere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to turn all one's weapons against him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 111</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36746.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A permanent breastwork</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a parapet</hi>, on towers, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">pluteos vallo addere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plutei turrium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rates a fronte atque ab utroque latere, cratibus ac pluteis protegebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 25, 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 15, 3: viminei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus consaeptus cratibus pluteisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:38:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 38, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36746.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The back-board</hi>, <hi rend="ital">back</hi>, of a settee or couch, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 26</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of the couch on which guests reclined at table: somni post vina petuntur, ... puer pluteo vindice tutus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:91:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 91, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36746.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a couch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dining-couch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 8, 68.—</sense><sense id="n36746.4" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The board on which a corpse is placed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:44:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 44, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36746.5" n="V" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A book-shelf</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bookcase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desk</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:106" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 106</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">with busts upon it,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:7" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:1:17:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 1, 17, § 4</bibl>; Sid. Ep. <cb n="POBL" /> 2, 9.—</sense><sense id="n36746.6" n="VI" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A partition-wall between two columns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a balustrade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parapet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 4, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pluto: <entryFree id="n36747" type="main" key="Plu_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Plūto</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Plūton</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*plou/twn</foreign>, <sense id="n36747.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the king of the Lower World</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the husband of Proserpine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and brother of Jupiter and Neptune</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:26:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 26, 66</bibl>; Hyg. praef.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 327</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:50" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 50</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> Gr. Plutona, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 14, 7</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36747.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Plūtōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pluto</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Plutonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et domus exilis Plutonia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the realms. of death</tr>, <tr>the Lower Regions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 17</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Plūtō-nĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">a pestilential district in Asia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:36:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 36, 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plutor: <entryFree id="n36748" type="main" key="plu_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plūtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pluo</etym>, <sense id="n36748.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the rainer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">he who sends rain</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. Divers. 8:3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. Divers. 8, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
plutus: <entryFree id="n36749" type="main" key="Plu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Plūtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*plou=tos</foreign>, <sense id="n36749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Plutus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the god of riches</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 12, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pluvia: <entryFree id="n36750" type="main" key="plu^vi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plŭvĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. aqua) [pluvius]. <sense id="n36750.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Rain</hi> (class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">imber): pluvias metuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in gens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 325</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a pluviā tueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:202" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de pluviis loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pluviarum signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:9:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui aufert stillas pluviae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 36, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36750.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a fall</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shower</hi> of any thing (post-class.; cf. pluo); <cit><quote lang="la">of blossoms,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Nupt. Honor. 298</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pluvia ignea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Quaest. in Num. 4:27" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Quaest. in Num. 4, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 105:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Serm. 105, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36750.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Rain-water</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">admixtā pluviā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 6, 34, § 103</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pluvialia: <entryFree id="n36751" type="main" key="Plu^vi^a_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Plŭvĭālĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. insula), <sense id="n36751.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Fortunate Isles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 32, 37, § 202</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pluvialis: <entryFree id="n36752" type="main" key="plu^vi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plŭvĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pluvia</etym>, <sense id="n36752.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to rain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rainy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rain-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Auster,</quote> <trans><tr>rainbringing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:429" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 429</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Haedi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:668" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 9, 668</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:594" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 594</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fungi,</quote> <trans><tr>which are produced by rain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:393" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 393</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <trans><tr>rainwater</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:7:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pluviaticus: <entryFree id="n36753" type="main" key="plu^vi^a_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plŭvĭātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36753.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to rain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rain-</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pluviatilis: <entryFree id="n36754" type="main" key="plu^vi^a_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plŭvĭātĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36754.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to rain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rain-</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:1:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 1, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pluviosus: <entryFree id="n36755" type="main" key="plu^vi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plŭvĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36755.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of rain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rainy</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">hiems,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 25, 60, § 225</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pluvius: <entryFree id="n36756" type="main" key="plu^vi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">plŭvĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pluo</etym>, <sense id="n36756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rainy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">causing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bringing rain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rain-</hi> (class.): SI AQVA PLVVIA NOCET, <hi rend="ital">rain-water</hi>, Fragm. XII. Tab.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 9, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:9:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 9, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:13:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hyades,</quote> <trans><tr>rain-bringing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:516" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 516</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rores,</quote> <trans><tr>rain</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcus,</quote> <trans><tr>rainbow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter,</quote> <trans><tr>who dispenses rain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8</bibl></cit> (7), 26 (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter uvidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 418</bibl></cit>, and <foreign lang="greek">*zeu\s i)kmai=os</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli status,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:39:section=106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 39, § 106</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">plŭvĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = impluvium, q. v., <hi rend="ital">the inner court of a dwelling</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pneumaticus: <entryFree id="n36757" type="greek" key="pneuma^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pneumătĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">pneumatiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to air</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to wind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">air-</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wind-</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pneumatic;</hi> of machines that are driven by the force of air: <cit><quote lang="la">Ctesibius, qui pneumaticas res invenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">organa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 4, 20, § 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 37, 38, § 125</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pneumatomachi: <entryFree id="n36758" type="main" key="Pneuma^to^ma^chi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pneumătŏmăchi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pneumatoma/xoi</foreign> (fighters with the Spirit), <sense id="n36758.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sect of heretics</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 5, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pnigeus: <entryFree id="n36759" type="greek" key="pni_geus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pnīgeus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dissyl.</orth>), <itype>ei</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pnigeu/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36759.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cover</hi> or <hi rend="ital">damper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which keeps down the rising air in the hydraulic organ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pnigitis: <entryFree id="n36760" type="greek" key="pni_gi_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pnīgītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pnigi=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n36760.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of potter's clay</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 16, 56, § 194</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pnytagoras: <entryFree id="n36761" type="main" key="Pny^ta^go^ras"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pnytăgŏras</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36761.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Cyprus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an ally of Alexander the Great</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:8:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 8, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
po: <entryFree id="n36762" type="main" key="po'" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">po'</orth>, an old form of post; as, po' meridiem, mentioned by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 39</bibl>.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36763" type="main" key="po1" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">po</orth>, <sense id="n36763.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">insep. prep.</hi> (cf. <foreign lang="greek">poti/, pro/s</foreign>), a prefix denoting power or possession, or that renders emphatic the meaning of a verb; as in polleo, polliceor, pono.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36763.1" type="gloss" key="po2" n="3" level="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">po</orth> <itype>pro potissimum positum est in Saliari carmine</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=205" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 205</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
poblilia: <entryFree id="n36764" type="main" key="Pobli^li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Poblĭlĭa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Publĭlĭa</orth> <itype>tribus</itype> (also, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Publĭa, Publĭcĭa, Popĭlĭa, Popĭl-lĭa</orth>), <sense id="n36764.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the rustic tribes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 15</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 568, 1</bibl>; Inscr. Don. cl. 6, n. 112; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Maff.</author> Ver. Illustr. 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=233" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 233</bibl> Müll.; cf.: Popillia tribus a progenitrice traxit vocabulum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=232" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 232</bibl> Müll. <pb n="1390" /> <cb n="PODI" /></sense></entryFree>
pocillator: <entryFree id="n36765" type="main" key="po_cilla_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōcillātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pocillum</etym>, <sense id="n36765.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cupbearer</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quo, Jovi pocillatorem Phrygium sustulerat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Ganymede</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 179, 16</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10</bibl>, p. 247.</sense></entryFree>
pocillum: <entryFree id="n36766" type="main" key="po_cillum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōcillum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>poculum</etym>, <sense id="n36766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little cup</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pocillum fictile,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 13, 14, § 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">argenteum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
poculentus: <entryFree id="n36767" type="main" key="po_cu^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōcŭlentus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">poscŭl-, pōtŭl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">drinkable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">potable</hi>: penus est quod esculentum aut poculentum est, etc., Q. Scaevola ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:1:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 1, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36767.1" n="II" level="1"> Of vessels, <hi rend="ital">fit for use in drinking</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a poculento argento vascularius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 643, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
poculum: <entryFree id="n36768" type="main" key="po_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōcŭlum</orth> (contr. <orth extent="full" lang="la">pōclum</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">89</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 175</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>from root po-, pot; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pi/nw</foreign>, v. potus</etym>. <sense id="n36768.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a drinking-vessel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cup</hi>, <hi rend="ital">goblet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bowl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beaker</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: calix, cyathus): et nobis idem Alcimedon duo pocula fecit, Verg. E: 3, 44: poculum grande,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnis poculis aliquem invitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exhaurire poculum,</quote> <trans><tr>to empty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 11, 31</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 17, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siccare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poscunt majoribus poculis (sc. bibere),</quote> <trans><tr>out of goblets</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:26:section=66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 26, § 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stans extra poculum caper,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>in relief</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:76" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 76</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 43</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem poculo bibere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to undergo the same sufferings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 2, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36768.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36768.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A drink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draught</hi>, <hi rend="ital">potion</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">si semel poculum amoris accepit meri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salsa pocula,</quote> <trans><tr>sea-water</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 7, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pocula sunt fontes liquidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:529" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 529</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amoris poculum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a philter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:38" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 38</bibl></cit>; also, <cit><quote lang="la">desiderii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 17, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prae poculis nescientes,</quote> <trans><tr>through drunkenness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:10:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pocula praegustare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:633" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 633</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poculum ex vino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,031:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Cant. 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36768.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A drinking-bout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a carouse</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">in ipsis tuis immanibus poculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:25:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 25, 63</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">is sermo, qui more majorum a summo adhibetur in poculis,</quote> <trans><tr>while drinking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 14, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36768.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A draught of poison</hi>, alicui poculum dare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 10, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 295</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:155" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 155</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
podager: <entryFree id="n36769" type="greek" key="po^da^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏdăger</orth>, <itype>gri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">podagro/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who has the gout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a gouty man</hi> (ante- and postclass. for podagricus): numquam poetor nisi si podager, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 829</bibl> P. (Sat. v. 8 Vahl.); <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Epigr. 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
podagra: <entryFree id="n36770" type="greek" key="po^da_^gra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏdā^gra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">poda/gra</foreign>, <sense id="n36770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the gout in the feet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">doloribus podagrae cruciari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:19:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 19, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum arderet podagrae doloribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:31:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 31, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nodosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:3:23" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 3, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 10, 64, § 100</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">locuples,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:96" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 96</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
podagricus: <entryFree id="n36771" type="greek" key="po^da_^gri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏdā^grĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">podagriko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36771.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gouty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">podagric</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tot feminae podagricae calvaeque sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 15:3:21" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 15, 3, 21</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏdā^grĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a gouty person</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">podagrici pedibus suis maledicunt, chiragrici manibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 132</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
podagrosus: <entryFree id="n36772" type="main" key="po^da_^gro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏdā^grōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>podagra</etym>, <sense id="n36772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having the gout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gouty</hi> (ante-class.): deformis senex, arthriticus ac podagrosus, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 166, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">podagrosi estis ac vicistis cochleam tarditudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
podalirius: <entryFree id="n36773" type="main" key="Po^da^li_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŏdălīrĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*podalei/rios</foreign>. <sense id="n36773.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Æsculapius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a celebrated physician</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:6:11" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 6, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:735" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 735</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36773.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Trojan who followed Æneas to Italy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 304</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36773.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman surname</hi>: C. PETRONIVS PODALIRIVS, Inscr. Amaduzzi Anecd. Litter. t. l. p. 463.</sense></entryFree>
poderes: <entryFree id="n36774" type="greek" key="po^de_res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏdēres</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏdēris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">podh/rhs</foreign>, <sense id="n36774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a long garment descending to the ankle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worn by the priests</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 11</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in veste poderis quam habebat totus erat orbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:18:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 18, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
podex: <entryFree id="n36775" type="main" key="po_dex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pōdex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>perh. for pordex, from pedo, ere</etym>, <sense id="n36775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the fundament</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:8:6" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 8, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lēvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:12" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
podia: <entryFree id="n36776" type="main" key="po^di^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏdĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n36776.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rope fastened to one of the lower corners of a sail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for the purpose of setting it to the wind;</hi> in Engl. nautical lang., <hi rend="ital">a sheet</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 5, 830</bibl> (al. podium).</sense></entryFree>
podiarius: <entryFree id="n36777" type="gloss" key="po^di^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏdĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>podium</etym>, <sense id="n36777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who performs mimes on the stage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a mime</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 174</bibl>: podiarius, inter mimos, Gloss. Isid.</sense></entryFree>
podicus: <entryFree id="n36778" type="main" key="po^di^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏdĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">pou=s</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n36778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a foot</hi> (post-class.): sed temporum<cb n="POEN" />  alia simplicia sunt, quae podica etiam perhibentur. Pes veri est numeri prima progressio, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 974</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
podismatus: <entryFree id="n36779" type="main" key="po^disma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏdismātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>podismus</etym>, <sense id="n36779.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">measured out by feet</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Colon. p. 132" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Colon. p. 132</bibl></cit> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
podismus: <entryFree id="n36780" type="greek" key="po^dismus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏdismus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">podismo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36780.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a measuring out by feet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foot-measure</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ad podismum dimetiri loca,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Colon. p. 130" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Colon. p. 130</bibl> Goes.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4570</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
podium: <entryFree id="n36781" type="greek" key="po^di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŏdĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">po/dion</foreign>, <sense id="n36781.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an elevated place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a height.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36781.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">podia ternis alta pedibus fabricantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36781.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n36781.3" n="A" level="2"> A projection in a building, <hi rend="ital">a jutty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">balcony</hi>, <hi rend="ital">podium</hi> (postAug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:12:section=22" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 12, § 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36781.4" n="B" level="2"> A projecting part in the circus or amphitheatre, <hi rend="ital">a parapet</hi> or <hi rend="ital">balcony next to the arena</hi>, where the emperor and other distinguished persons sat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 12</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 3, 11, § 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes ad podium spectantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:147" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 147</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
